arg.info: place to save the malloc() function in use

arg.name: reallocFunc
arg.info: place to save the realloc() function in use

arg.name: strdupFunc
arg.info: place to save the strdup() function in use

function.name: xmlMemMalloc
function.info: a malloc() equivalent, with logging of the allocation info.

return.info: a pointer to the allocated area or NULL in case of lack of memory.

arg.name: size
arg.info: an int specifying the size in byte to allocate.

function.name: xmlMemRealloc
function.info: a realloc() equivalent, with logging of the allocation info.

return.info: a pointer to the allocated area or NULL in case of lack of memory.

arg.name: size
arg.info: an int specifying the size in byte to allocate.

function.name: xmlMemSetup
function.info: Override the default memory access functions with a new set This has to be called before any other libxml routines ! Should this be blocked if there was already some allocations done ?

return.info: 0 on success

function.name: xmlMemShow
function.info: show a show display of the memory allocated, and dump the @nr last allocated areas which were not freed

arg.name: fp
arg.info: a FILE descriptor used as the output file

function.name: xmlMemStrdupLoc
function.info: a strdup() equivalent, with logging of the allocation info.

return.info: a pointer to the new string or NULL if allocation error occurred.

function.name: xmlMemUsed
function.info: Provides the amount of memory currently allocated

return.info: an int representing the amount of memory allocated.

function.name: xmlMemoryDump
function.info: Dump in-extenso the memory blocks allocated to the file .memorylist

function.name: xmlMemoryStrdup
function.info: a strdup() equivalent, with logging of the allocation info.

return.info: a pointer to the new string or NULL if allocation error occurred.

function.name: xmlModuleClose
function.info: The close operations unload the associated module and free the data associated to the module.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of argument error and -2 if the module could not be closed/unloaded.

function.name: xmlModuleFree
function.info: The free operations free the data associated to the module but does not unload the associated shared library which may still be in use.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of argument error

function.name: xmlModuleOpen
function.info: Opens a module/shared library given its name or path TODO: options are not yet implemented.

return.info: a handle for the module or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlModuleSymbol
function.info: Lookup for a symbol address in the given module

return.info: 0 if the symbol was found, or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlMutexLock
function.info: xmlMutexLock() is used to lock a libxml2 token.

function.name: xmlMutexUnlock
function.info: xmlMutexUnlock() is used to unlock a libxml2 token.

function.name: xmlNamespaceParseNCName
function.info: parse an XML namespace name. TODO: this seems not in use anymore, the namespace handling is done on top of the SAX interfaces, i.e. not on raw input. [NS 3] NCName ::= (Letter | '_') (NCNameChar)* [NS 4] NCNameChar ::= Letter | Digit | '.' | '-' | '_' | CombiningChar | Extender

return.info: the namespace name or NULL

function.name: xmlNamespaceParseNSDef
function.info: parse a namespace prefix declaration TODO: this seems not in use anymore, the namespace handling is done on top of the SAX interfaces, i.e. not on raw input. [NS 1] NSDef ::= PrefixDef Eq SystemLiteral [NS 2] PrefixDef ::= 'xmlns' (':' NCName)?

return.info: the namespace name

function.name: xmlNamespaceParseQName
function.info: TODO: this seems not in use anymore, the namespace handling is done on top of the SAX interfaces, i.e. not on raw input. parse an XML qualified name [NS 5] QName ::= (Prefix ':')? LocalPart [NS 6] Prefix ::= NCName [NS 7] LocalPart ::= NCName

return.info: the local part, and prefix is updated to get the Prefix if any.

function.name: xmlNanoFTPCheckResponse
function.info: Check if there is a response from the FTP server after a command.

return.info: the code number, or 0

function.name: xmlNanoFTPCleanup
function.info: Cleanup the FTP protocol layer. This cleanup proxy informations.

function.name: xmlNanoFTPClose
function.info: Close the connection and both control and transport

return.info: -1 incase of error, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlNanoFTPCloseConnection
function.info: Close the data connection from the server

return.info: -1 incase of error, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlNanoFTPConnect
function.info: Tries to open a control connection

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlNanoFTPConnectTo
function.info: Tries to open a control connection to the given server/port

return.info: an fTP context or NULL if it failed

function.name: xmlNanoFTPCwd
function.info: Tries to change the remote directory

return.info: -1 incase of error, 1 if CWD worked, 0 if it failed

function.name: xmlNanoFTPDele
function.info: Tries to delete an item (file or directory) from server

return.info: -1 incase of error, 1 if DELE worked, 0 if it failed

arg.name: file
arg.info: a file or directory on the server

function.name: xmlNanoFTPFreeCtxt
function.info: Frees the context after closing the connection.

function.name: xmlNanoFTPGet
function.info: Fetch the given file from the server. All data are passed back in the callbacks. The last callback has a size of 0 block.

return.info: -1 incase of error, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlNanoFTPGetConnection
function.info: Try to open a data connection to the server. Currently only passive mode is supported.

return.info: -1 incase of error, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlNanoFTPGetResponse
function.info: Get the response from the FTP server after a command.

return.info: the code number

function.name: xmlNanoFTPGetSocket
function.info: Initiate fetch of the given file from the server.

return.info: the socket for the data connection, or <0 in case of error

arg.name: filename
arg.info: the file to retrieve (or NULL if path is in context).

function.name: xmlNanoFTPInit
function.info: Initialize the FTP protocol layer. Currently it just checks for proxy informations, and get the hostname

function.name: xmlNanoFTPList
function.info: Do a listing on the server. All files info are passed back in the callbacks.

return.info: -1 incase of error, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlNanoFTPNewCtxt
function.info: Allocate and initialize a new FTP context.

return.info: an FTP context or NULL in case of error.

arg.name: URL
arg.info: The URL used to initialize the context

function.name: xmlNanoFTPOpen
function.info: Start to fetch the given ftp:// resource

return.info: an FTP context, or NULL

function.name: xmlNanoFTPProxy
function.info: Setup the FTP proxy informations. This can also be done by using ftp_proxy ftp_proxy_user and ftp_proxy_password environment variables.

arg.name: type
arg.info: the type of proxy 1 for using SITE, 2 for USER a@b

function.name: xmlNanoFTPQuit
function.info: Send a QUIT command to the server

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlNanoFTPRead
function.info: This function tries to read @len bytes from the existing FTP connection and saves them in @dest. This is a blocking call.

return.info: the number of byte read. 0 is an indication of an end of connection. -1 indicates a parameter error.

function.name: xmlNanoFTPScanProxy
function.info: (Re)Initialize the FTP Proxy context by parsing the URL and finding the protocol host port it indicates. Should be like ftp://myproxy/ or ftp://myproxy:3128/ A NULL URL cleans up proxy informations.

arg.name: URL
arg.info: The proxy URL used to initialize the proxy context

function.name: xmlNanoFTPUpdateURL
function.info: Update an FTP context by parsing the URL and finding new path it indicates. If there is an error in the protocol, hostname, port or other information, the error is raised. It indicates a new connection has to be established.

return.info: 0 if Ok, -1 in case of error (other host).

arg.name: URL
arg.info: The URL used to update the context

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPAuthHeader
function.info: Get the authentication header of an HTTP context

return.info: the stashed value of the WWW-Authenticate or Proxy-Authenticate header.

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPCleanup
function.info: Cleanup the HTTP protocol layer.

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPClose
function.info: This function closes an HTTP context, it ends up the connection and free all data related to it.

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPContentLength
function.info: Provides the specified content length from the HTTP header.

return.info: the specified content length from the HTTP header. Note that a value of -1 indicates that the content length element was not included in the response header.

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPEncoding
function.info: Provides the specified encoding if specified in the HTTP headers.

return.info: the specified encoding or NULL if not available

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPFetch
function.info: This function try to fetch the indicated resource via HTTP GET and save it's content in the file.

return.info: -1 in case of failure, 0 incase of success. The contentType, if provided must be freed by the caller

arg.name: filename
arg.info: the filename where the content should be saved

arg.name: contentType
arg.info: if available the Content-Type information will be returned at that location

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPInit
function.info: Initialize the HTTP protocol layer. Currently it just checks for proxy informations

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPMethod
function.info: This function try to open a connection to the indicated resource via HTTP using the given @method, adding the given extra headers and the input buffer for the request content.

return.info: NULL in case of failure, otherwise a request handler. The contentType, if provided must be freed by the caller

arg.name: contentType
arg.info: the Content-Type information IN and OUT

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPMethodRedir
function.info: This function try to open a connection to the indicated resource via HTTP using the given @method, adding the given extra headers and the input buffer for the request content.

return.info: NULL in case of failure, otherwise a request handler. The contentType, or redir, if provided must be freed by the caller

arg.name: contentType
arg.info: the Content-Type information IN and OUT

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPMimeType
function.info: Provides the specified Mime-Type if specified in the HTTP headers.

return.info: the specified Mime-Type or NULL if not available

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPOpen
function.info: This function try to open a connection to the indicated resource via HTTP GET.

return.info: NULL in case of failure, otherwise a request handler. The contentType, if provided must be freed by the caller

arg.name: contentType
arg.info: if available the Content-Type information will be returned at that location

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPOpenRedir
function.info: This function try to open a connection to the indicated resource via HTTP GET.

return.info: NULL in case of failure, otherwise a request handler. The contentType, if provided must be freed by the caller

arg.name: contentType
arg.info: if available the Content-Type information will be returned at that location

arg.name: redir
arg.info: if available the redirected URL will be returned

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPRead
function.info: This function tries to read @len bytes from the existing HTTP connection and saves them in @dest. This is a blocking call.

return.info: the number of byte read. 0 is an indication of an end of connection. -1 indicates a parameter error.

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPRedir
function.info: Provides the specified redirection URL if available from the HTTP header.

return.info: the specified redirection URL or NULL if not redirected.

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPReturnCode
function.info: Get the latest HTTP return code received

return.info: the HTTP return code for the request.

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPSave
function.info: This function saves the output of the HTTP transaction to a file It closes and free the context at the end

return.info: -1 in case of failure, 0 incase of success.

arg.name: filename
arg.info: the filename where the content should be saved

function.name: xmlNanoHTTPScanProxy
function.info: (Re)Initialize the HTTP Proxy context by parsing the URL and finding the protocol host port it indicates. Should be like http://myproxy/ or http://myproxy:3128/ A NULL URL cleans up proxy informations.

arg.name: URL
arg.info: The proxy URL used to initialize the proxy context

function.name: xmlNewAutomata
function.info: Create a new automata

return.info: the new object or NULL in case of failure

function.info: Creation of a new node containing a CDATA block.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

return.info: the xmlCatalogPtr or NULL in case of error

arg.name: sgml
arg.info: should this create an SGML catalog

function.name: xmlNewCharEncodingHandler
function.info: Create and registers an xmlCharEncodingHandler.

return.info: the xmlCharEncodingHandlerPtr created (or NULL in case of error).

arg.info: the encoding name, in UTF-8 format (ASCII actually)

arg.info: the xmlCharEncodingInputFunc to read that encoding

arg.name: output
arg.info: the xmlCharEncodingOutputFunc to write that encoding

function.name: xmlNewCharRef
function.info: Creation of a new character reference node.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

arg.name: name
arg.info: the char ref string, starting with # or "&# ... ;"

function.name: xmlNewChild
function.info: Creation of a new child element, added at the end of @parent children list. @ns and @content parameters are optional (NULL). If @ns is NULL, the newly created element inherits the namespace of @parent. If @content is non NULL, a child list containing the TEXTs and ENTITY_REFs node will be created. NOTE: @content is supposed to be a piece of XML CDATA, so it allows entity references. XML special chars must be escaped first by using xmlEncodeEntitiesReentrant(), or xmlNewTextChild() should be used.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

arg.name: content
arg.info: the XML content of the child if any.

function.name: xmlNewComment
function.info: Creation of a new node containing a comment.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewDoc
function.info: Creates a new XML document

return.info: a new document

arg.name: version
arg.info: xmlChar string giving the version of XML "1.0"

function.name: xmlNewDocComment
function.info: Creation of a new node containing a comment within a document.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewDocElementContent
function.info: Allocate an element content structure for the document.

return.info: NULL if not, otherwise the new element content structure

arg.name: type
arg.info: the type of element content decl

function.name: xmlNewDocFragment
function.info: Creation of a new Fragment node.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewDocNode
function.info: Creation of a new node element within a document. @ns and @content are optional (NULL). NOTE: @content is supposed to be a piece of XML CDATA, so it allow entities references, but XML special chars need to be escaped first by using xmlEncodeEntitiesReentrant(). Use xmlNewDocRawNode() if you don't need entities support.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

arg.name: content
arg.info: the XML text content if any

function.name: xmlNewDocNodeEatName
function.info: Creation of a new node element within a document. @ns and @content are optional (NULL). NOTE: @content is supposed to be a piece of XML CDATA, so it allow entities references, but XML special chars need to be escaped first by using xmlEncodeEntitiesReentrant(). Use xmlNewDocRawNode() if you don't need entities support.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

arg.name: content
arg.info: the XML text content if any

function.name: xmlNewDocPI
function.info: Creation of a processing instruction element.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewDocProp
function.info: Create a new property carried by a document.

return.info: a pointer to the attribute

function.name: xmlNewDocRawNode
function.info: Creation of a new node element within a document. @ns and @content are optional (NULL).

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewDocText
function.info: Creation of a new text node within a document.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewDocTextLen
function.info: Creation of a new text node with an extra content length parameter. The text node pertain to a given document.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewDtd
function.info: Creation of a new DTD for the external subset. To create an internal subset, use xmlCreateIntSubset().

return.info: a pointer to the new DTD structure

function.name: xmlNewElementContent
function.info: Allocate an element content structure. Deprecated in favor of xmlNewDocElementContent

return.info: NULL if not, otherwise the new element content structure

arg.name: type
arg.info: the type of element content decl

function.name: xmlNewEntityInputStream
function.info: Create a new input stream based on an xmlEntityPtr

return.info: the new input stream or NULL

function.name: xmlNewGlobalNs
function.info: Creation of a Namespace, the old way using PI and without scoping DEPRECATED !!! It now create a namespace on the root element of the document if found.

return.info: NULL this functionality had been removed

function.name: xmlNewIOInputStream
function.info: Create a new input stream structure encapsulating the @input into a stream suitable for the parser.

return.info: the new input stream or NULL

function.name: xmlNewInputFromFile
function.info: Create a new input stream based on a file or an URL.

return.info: the new input stream or NULL in case of error

arg.name: filename
arg.info: the filename to use as entity

function.name: xmlNewInputStream
function.info: Create a new input stream structure

return.info: the new input stream or NULL

function.name: xmlNewMutex
function.info: xmlNewMutex() is used to allocate a libxml2 token struct for use in synchronizing access to data.

return.info: a new simple mutex pointer or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlNewNode
function.info: Creation of a new node element. @ns is optional (NULL).

return.info: a pointer to the new node object. Uses xmlStrdup() to make copy of @name.

function.name: xmlNewNodeEatName
function.info: Creation of a new node element. @ns is optional (NULL).

return.info: a pointer to the new node object, with pointer @name as new node's name. Use xmlNewNode() if a copy of @name string is is needed as new node's name.

function.name: xmlNewNs
function.info: Creation of a new Namespace. This function will refuse to create a namespace with a similar prefix than an existing one present on this node. We use href==NULL in the case of an element creation where the namespace was not defined.

return.info: a new namespace pointer or NULL

function.name: xmlNewNsProp
function.info: Create a new property tagged with a namespace and carried by a node.

return.info: a pointer to the attribute

function.name: xmlNewNsPropEatName
function.info: Create a new property tagged with a namespace and carried by a node.

return.info: a pointer to the attribute

function.name: xmlNewPI
function.info: Creation of a processing instruction element. Use xmlDocNewPI preferably to get string interning

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewParserCtxt
function.info: Allocate and initialize a new parser context.

return.info: the xmlParserCtxtPtr or NULL

function.name: xmlNewProp
function.info: Create a new property carried by a node.

return.info: a pointer to the attribute

function.name: xmlNewRMutex
function.info: xmlRNewMutex() is used to allocate a reentrant mutex for use in synchronizing access to data. token_r is a re-entrant lock and thus useful for synchronizing access to data structures that may be manipulated in a recursive fashion.

return.info: the new reentrant mutex pointer or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlNewReference
function.info: Creation of a new reference node.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

arg.name: name
arg.info: the reference name, or the reference string with & and ;

function.name: xmlNewStringInputStream
function.info: Create a new input stream based on a memory buffer.

return.info: the new input stream

function.name: xmlNewText
function.info: Creation of a new text node.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

function.name: xmlNewTextChild
function.info: Creation of a new child element, added at the end of @parent children list. @ns and @content parameters are optional (NULL). If @ns is NULL, the newly created element inherits the namespace of @parent. If @content is non NULL, a child TEXT node will be created containing the string @content. NOTE: Use xmlNewChild() if @content will contain entities that need to be preserved. Use this function, xmlNewTextChild(), if you need to ensure that reserved XML chars that might appear in @content, such as the ampersand, greater-than or less-than signs, are automatically replaced by their XML escaped entity representations.

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

arg.name: content
arg.info: the text content of the child if any.

function.name: xmlNewTextLen
function.info: Creation of a new text node with an extra parameter for the content's length

return.info: a pointer to the new node object.

return.info: the new xmlTextReaderPtr or NULL in case of error

arg.name: URI

function.name: xmlNextChar
function.info: Skip to the next char input char.

arg.info: the URL for the entity to load

function.name: xmlNodeAddContent
function.info: Append the extra substring to the node content.

function.name: xmlNodeAddContentLen
function.info: Append the extra substring to the node content.

function.name: xmlNodeBufGetContent
function.info: Read the value of a node @cur, this can be either the text carried directly by this node if it's a TEXT node or the aggregate string of the values carried by this node child's (TEXT and ENTITY_REF). Entity references are substituted. Fills up the buffer @buffer with this value

return.info: 0 in case of success and -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlNodeDump
function.info: Dump an XML node, recursive behaviour,children are printed too. Note that @format = 1 provide node indenting only if xmlIndentTreeOutput = 1 or xmlKeepBlanksDefault(0) was called

return.info: the number of bytes written to the buffer or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlNodeDumpOutput
function.info: Dump an XML node, recursive behaviour, children are printed too. Note that @format = 1 provide node indenting only if xmlIndentTreeOutput = 1 or xmlKeepBlanksDefault(0) was called

function.name: xmlNodeGetBase
function.info: Searches for the BASE URL. The code should work on both XML and HTML document even if base mechanisms are completely different. It returns the base as defined in RFC 2396 sections 5.1.1. Base URI within Document Content and 5.1.2. Base URI from the Encapsulating Entity However it does not return the document base (5.1.3), use xmlDocumentGetBase() for this

return.info: a pointer to the base URL, or NULL if not found It's up to the caller to free the memory with xmlFree().

arg.name: doc
arg.info: the document the node pertains to

function.name: xmlNodeGetContent
function.info: Read the value of a node, this can be either the text carried directly by this node if it's a TEXT node or the aggregate string of the values carried by this node child's (TEXT and ENTITY_REF). Entity references are substituted.

return.info: a new #xmlChar * or NULL if no content is available. It's up to the caller to free the memory with xmlFree().

function.name: xmlNodeGetLang
function.info: Searches the language of a node, i.e. the values of the xml:lang attribute or the one carried by the nearest ancestor.

return.info: a pointer to the lang value, or NULL if not found It's up to the caller to free the memory with xmlFree().

function.name: xmlNodeGetSpacePreserve
function.info: Searches the space preserving behaviour of a node, i.e. the values of the xml:space attribute or the one carried by the nearest ancestor.

return.info: -1 if xml:space is not inherited, 0 if "default", 1 if "preserve"

function.name: xmlNodeIsText
function.info: Is this node a Text node ?

return.info: 1 yes, 0 no

function.name: xmlNodeListGetRawString
function.info: Builds the string equivalent to the text contained in the Node list made of TEXTs and ENTITY_REFs, contrary to xmlNodeListGetString() this function doesn't do any character encoding handling.

return.info: a pointer to the string copy, the caller must free it with xmlFree().

arg.name: inLine
arg.info: should we replace entity contents or show their external form

function.name: xmlNodeListGetString
function.info: Build the string equivalent to the text contained in the Node list made of TEXTs and ENTITY_REFs

return.info: a pointer to the string copy, the caller must free it with xmlFree().

arg.name: inLine
arg.info: should we replace entity contents or show their external form

function.name: xmlNodeSetBase
function.info: Set (or reset) the base URI of a node, i.e. the value of the xml:base attribute.

function.name: xmlNodeSetContent
function.info: Replace the content of a node.

arg.name: content
arg.info: the new value of the content

function.name: xmlNodeSetContentLen
function.info: Replace the content of a node.

arg.name: content
arg.info: the new value of the content

function.name: xmlNodeSetLang
function.info: Set the language of a node, i.e. the values of the xml:lang attribute.

function.name: xmlNodeSetName
function.info: Set (or reset) the name of a node.

function.name: xmlNodeSetSpacePreserve
function.info: Set (or reset) the space preserving behaviour of a node, i.e. the value of the xml:space attribute.

function.name: xmlNormalizeURIPath
function.info: Applies the 5 normalization steps to a path string--that is, RFC 2396 Section 5.2, steps 6.c through 6.g. Normalization occurs directly on the string, no new allocation is done

return.info: 0 or an error code

function.name: xmlNormalizeWindowsPath
function.info: This function is obsolete. Please see xmlURIFromPath in uri.c for a better solution.

return.info: a canonicalized version of the path

function.name: xmlOutputBufferClose
function.info: flushes and close the output I/O channel and free up all the associated resources

return.info: the number of byte written or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlOutputBufferCreateFd
function.info: Create a buffered output for the progressive saving to a file descriptor

return.info: the new parser output or NULL

function.name: xmlOutputBufferCreateFile
function.info: Create a buffered output for the progressive saving to a FILE * buffered C I/O

return.info: the new parser output or NULL

function.name: xmlOutputBufferCreateFilename
function.info: Create a buffered output for the progressive saving of a file If filename is "-' then we use stdout as the output. Automatic support for ZLIB/Compress compressed document is provided by default if found at compile-time. TODO: currently if compression is set, the library only support writing to a local file.

return.info: the new output or NULL

arg.name: URI
arg.info: a C string containing the URI or filename

function.name: xmlOutputBufferCreateFilenameDefault
function.info: Registers a callback for URI output file handling

return.info: the old value of the registration function

arg.name: func
arg.info: function pointer to the new OutputBufferCreateFilenameFunc

function.name: xmlOutputBufferCreateIO
function.info: Create a buffered output for the progressive saving to an I/O handler

return.info: the new parser output or NULL

function.name: xmlOutputBufferFlush
function.info: flushes the output I/O channel

return.info: the number of byte written or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlOutputBufferWrite
function.info: Write the content of the array in the output I/O buffer This routine handle the I18N transcoding from internal UTF-8 The buffer is lossless, i.e. will store in case of partial or delayed writes.

return.info: the number of chars immediately written, or -1 in case of error.

arg.name: len
arg.info: the size in bytes of the array.

function.name: xmlOutputBufferWriteEscape
function.info: Write the content of the string in the output I/O buffer This routine escapes the caracters and then handle the I18N transcoding from internal UTF-8 The buffer is lossless, i.e. will store in case of partial or delayed writes.

return.info: the number of chars immediately written, or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlOutputBufferWriteString
function.info: Write the content of the string in the output I/O buffer This routine handle the I18N transcoding from internal UTF-8 The buffer is lossless, i.e. will store in case of partial or delayed writes.

return.info: the number of chars immediately written, or -1 in case of error.

functype.name: xmlOutputCloseCallback
functype.info: Callback used in the I/O Output API to close the resource

return.info: 0 or -1 in case of error

functype.name: xmlOutputMatchCallback
functype.info: Callback used in the I/O Output API to detect if the current handler can provide output fonctionnalities for this resource.

return.info: 1 if yes and 0 if another Output module should be used

functype.name: xmlOutputOpenCallback
functype.info: Callback used in the I/O Output API to open the resource

return.info: an Output context or NULL in case or error

functype.name: xmlOutputWriteCallback
functype.info: Callback used in the I/O Output API to write to the resource

return.info: the number of bytes written or -1 in case of error

arg.name: buffer
arg.info: the buffer of data to write

arg.name: len
arg.info: the length of the buffer in bytes

function.name: xmlParseAttValue
function.info: parse a value for an attribute Note: the parser won't do substitution of entities here, this will be handled later in xmlStringGetNodeList [10] AttValue ::= '"' ([^<&"] | Reference)* '"' | "'" ([^<&'] | Reference)* "'" 3.3.3 Attribute-Value Normalization: Before the value of an attribute is passed to the application or checked for validity, the XML processor must normalize it as follows: - a character reference is processed by appending the referenced character to the attribute value - an entity reference is processed by recursively processing the replacement text of the entity - a whitespace character (#x20, #xD, #xA, #x9) is processed by appending #x20 to the normalized value, except that only a single #x20 is appended for a "#xD#xA" sequence that is part of an external parsed entity or the literal entity value of an internal parsed entity - other characters are processed by appending them to the normalized value If the declared value is not CDATA, then the XML processor must further process the normalized attribute value by discarding any leading and trailing space (#x20) characters, and by replacing sequences of space (#x20) characters by a single space (#x20) character. All attributes for which no declaration has been read should be treated by a non-validating parser as if declared CDATA.

return.info: the AttValue parsed or NULL. The value has to be freed by the caller.

function.name: xmlParseAttribute
function.info: parse an attribute [41] Attribute ::= Name Eq AttValue [ WFC: No External Entity References ] Attribute values cannot contain direct or indirect entity references to external entities. [ WFC: No < in Attribute Values ] The replacement text of any entity referred to directly or indirectly in an attribute value (other than "<") must not contain a <. [ VC: Attribute Value Type ] The attribute must have been declared; the value must be of the type declared for it. [25] Eq ::= S? '=' S? With namespace: [NS 11] Attribute ::= QName Eq AttValue Also the case QName == xmlns:??? is handled independently as a namespace definition.

return.info: the attribute name, and the value in *value.

arg.name: value
arg.info: a xmlChar ** used to store the value of the attribute

function.name: xmlParseAttributeListDecl
function.info: : parse the Attribute list def for an element [52] AttlistDecl ::= '<!ATTLIST' S Name AttDef* S? '>' [53] AttDef ::= S Name S AttType S DefaultDecl

function.name: xmlParseAttributeType
function.info: parse the Attribute list def for an element [54] AttType ::= StringType | TokenizedType | EnumeratedType [55] StringType ::= 'CDATA' [56] TokenizedType ::= 'ID' | 'IDREF' | 'IDREFS' | 'ENTITY' | 'ENTITIES' | 'NMTOKEN' | 'NMTOKENS' Validity constraints for attribute values syntax are checked in xmlValidateAttributeValue() [ VC: ID ] Values of type ID must match the Name production. A name must not appear more than once in an XML document as a value of this type; i.e., ID values must uniquely identify the elements which bear them. [ VC: One ID per Element Type ] No element type may have more than one ID attribute specified. [ VC: ID Attribute Default ] An ID attribute must have a declared default of #IMPLIED or #REQUIRED. [ VC: IDREF ] Values of type IDREF must match the Name production, and values of type IDREFS must match Names; each IDREF Name must match the value of an ID attribute on some element in the XML document; i.e. IDREF values must match the value of some ID attribute. [ VC: Entity Name ] Values of type ENTITY must match the Name production, values of type ENTITIES must match Names; each Entity Name must match the name of an unparsed entity declared in the DTD. [ VC: Name Token ] Values of type NMTOKEN must match the Nmtoken production; values of type NMTOKENS must match Nmtokens.

return.info: the attribute type

arg.name: tree
arg.info: the enumeration tree built while parsing

function.name: xmlParseBalancedChunkMemory
function.info: Parse a well-balanced chunk of an XML document called by the parser The allowed sequence for the Well Balanced Chunk is the one defined by the content production in the XML grammar: [43] content ::= (element | CharData | Reference | CDSect | PI | Comment)*

return.info: 0 if the chunk is well balanced, -1 in case of args problem and the parser error code otherwise

arg.name: doc
arg.info: the document the chunk pertains to

arg.name: user_data
arg.info: The user data returned on SAX callbacks (possibly NULL)

arg.name: string
arg.info: the input string in UTF8 or ISO-Latin (zero terminated)

arg.name: lst
arg.info: the return value for the set of parsed nodes

function.name: xmlParseBalancedChunkMemoryRecover
function.info: Parse a well-balanced chunk of an XML document called by the parser The allowed sequence for the Well Balanced Chunk is the one defined by the content production in the XML grammar: [43] content ::= (element | CharData | Reference | CDSect | PI | Comment)*

return.info: 0 if the chunk is well balanced, -1 in case of args problem and the parser error code otherwise In case recover is set to 1, the nodelist will not be empty even if the parsed chunk is not well balanced.

arg.name: doc
arg.info: the document the chunk pertains to

arg.name: user_data
arg.info: The user data returned on SAX callbacks (possibly NULL)

arg.name: string
arg.info: the input string in UTF8 or ISO-Latin (zero terminated)

arg.name: lst
arg.info: the return value for the set of parsed nodes

arg.name: recover
arg.info: return nodes even if the data is broken (use 0)

function.name: xmlParseCDSect
function.info: Parse escaped pure raw content. [18] CDSect ::= CDStart CData CDEnd [19] CDStart ::= '<![CDATA[' [20] Data ::= (Char* - (Char* ']]>' Char*)) [21] CDEnd ::= ']]>'

function.name: xmlParseCatalogFile
function.info: parse an XML file and build a tree. It's like xmlParseFile() except it bypass all catalog lookups.

return.info: the resulting document tree or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlParseCharData
function.info: parse a CharData section. if we are within a CDATA section ']]>' marks an end of section. The right angle bracket (>) may be represented using the string ">", and must, for compatibility, be escaped using ">" or a character reference when it appears in the string "]]>" in content, when that string is not marking the end of a CDATA section. [14] CharData ::= [^<&]* - ([^<&]* ']]>' [^<&]*)

arg.name: cdata
arg.info: int indicating whether we are within a CDATA section

function.name: xmlParseCharEncoding
function.info: Compare the string to the encoding schemes already known. Note that the comparison is case insensitive accordingly to the section [XML] 4.3.3 Character Encoding in Entities.

return.info: one of the XML_CHAR_ENCODING_... values or XML_CHAR_ENCODING_NONE if not recognized.

arg.name: name
arg.info: the encoding name as parsed, in UTF-8 format (ASCII actually)

function.name: xmlParseCharRef
function.info: parse Reference declarations [66] CharRef ::= '&#' [0-9]+ ';' | '&#x' [0-9a-fA-F]+ ';' [ WFC: Legal Character ] Characters referred to using character references must match the production for Char.

return.info: the value parsed (as an int), 0 in case of error

function.name: xmlParseChunk
function.info: Parse a Chunk of memory

return.info: zero if no error, the xmlParserErrors otherwise.

arg.name: size
arg.info: the size in byte of the chunk

function.name: xmlParseComment
function.info: Skip an XML (SGML) comment <!-- .... --> The spec says that "For compatibility, the string "--" (double-hyphen) must not occur within comments. " [15] Comment ::= '<!--' ((Char - '-') | ('-' (Char - '-')))* '-->'

function.name: xmlParseContent
function.info: Parse a content: [43] content ::= (element | CharData | Reference | CDSect | PI | Comment)*

function.name: xmlParseCtxtExternalEntity
function.info: Parse an external general entity within an existing parsing context An external general parsed entity is well-formed if it matches the production labeled extParsedEnt. [78] extParsedEnt ::= TextDecl? content

return.info: 0 if the entity is well formed, -1 in case of args problem and the parser error code otherwise

arg.name: URL
arg.info: the URL for the entity to load

arg.name: ID
arg.info: the System ID for the entity to load

arg.name: lst
arg.info: the return value for the set of parsed nodes

function.name: xmlParseDTD
function.info: Load and parse an external subset.

return.info: the resulting xmlDtdPtr or NULL in case of error.

arg.name: ExternalID
arg.info: a NAME* containing the External ID of the DTD

arg.name: SystemID
arg.info: a NAME* containing the URL to the DTD

function.name: xmlParseDefaultDecl
function.info: Parse an attribute default declaration [60] DefaultDecl ::= '#REQUIRED' | '#IMPLIED' | (('#FIXED' S)? AttValue) [ VC: Required Attribute ] if the default declaration is the keyword #REQUIRED, then the attribute must be specified for all elements of the type in the attribute-list declaration. [ VC: Attribute Default Legal ] The declared default value must meet the lexical constraints of the declared attribute type c.f. xmlValidateAttributeDecl() [ VC: Fixed Attribute Default ] if an attribute has a default value declared with the #FIXED keyword, instances of that attribute must match the default value. [ WFC: No < in Attribute Values ] handled in xmlParseAttValue()

return.info: XML_ATTRIBUTE_NONE, XML_ATTRIBUTE_REQUIRED, XML_ATTRIBUTE_IMPLIED or XML_ATTRIBUTE_FIXED.

arg.name: value
arg.info: Receive a possible fixed default value for the attribute

function.name: xmlParseDoc
function.info: parse an XML in-memory document and build a tree.

return.info: the resulting document tree

arg.name: cur
arg.info: a pointer to an array of xmlChar

function.name: xmlParseDocTypeDecl
function.info: parse a DOCTYPE declaration [28] doctypedecl ::= '<!DOCTYPE' S Name (S ExternalID)? S? ('[' (markupdecl | PEReference | S)* ']' S?)? '>' [ VC: Root Element Type ] The Name in the document type declaration must match the element type of the root element.

function.name: xmlParseDocument
function.info: parse an XML document (and build a tree if using the standard SAX interface). [1] document ::= prolog element Misc* [22] prolog ::= XMLDecl? Misc* (doctypedecl Misc*)?

return.info: 0, -1 in case of error. the parser context is augmented as a result of the parsing.

function.name: xmlParseElement
function.info: parse an XML element, this is highly recursive [39] element ::= EmptyElemTag | STag content ETag [ WFC: Element Type Match ] The Name in an element's end-tag must match the element type in the start-tag.

function.name: xmlParseElementChildrenContentDecl
function.info: parse the declaration for a Mixed Element content The leading '(' and spaces have been skipped in xmlParseElementContentDecl [47] children ::= (choice | seq) ('?' | '*' | '+')? [48] cp ::= (Name | choice | seq) ('?' | '*' | '+')? [49] choice ::= '(' S? cp ( S? '|' S? cp )* S? ')' [50] seq ::= '(' S? cp ( S? ',' S? cp )* S? ')' [ VC: Proper Group/PE Nesting ] applies to [49] and [50] TODO Parameter-entity replacement text must be properly nested with parenthesized groups. That is to say, if either of the opening or closing parentheses in a choice, seq, or Mixed construct is contained in the replacement text for a parameter entity, both must be contained in the same replacement text. For interoperability, if a parameter-entity reference appears in a choice, seq, or Mixed construct, its replacement text should not be empty, and neither the first nor last non-blank character of the replacement text should be a connector (| or ,).

return.info: the tree of xmlElementContentPtr describing the element hierarchy.

arg.name: inputchk
arg.info: the input used for the current entity, needed for boundary checks

function.name: xmlParseElementContentDecl
function.info: parse the declaration for an Element content either Mixed or Children, the cases EMPTY and ANY are handled directly in xmlParseElementDecl [46] contentspec ::= 'EMPTY' | 'ANY' | Mixed | children

return.info: the type of element content XML_ELEMENT_TYPE_xxx

arg.name: name
arg.info: the name of the element being defined.

arg.name: result
arg.info: the Element Content pointer will be stored here if any

function.name: xmlParseElementDecl
function.info: parse an Element declaration. [45] elementdecl ::= '<!ELEMENT' S Name S contentspec S? '>' [ VC: Unique Element Type Declaration ] No element type may be declared more than once

return.info: the type of the element, or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlParseElementMixedContentDecl
function.info: parse the declaration for a Mixed Element content The leading '(' and spaces have been skipped in xmlParseElementContentDecl [51] Mixed ::= '(' S? '#PCDATA' (S? '|' S? Name)* S? ')*' | '(' S? '#PCDATA' S? ')' [ VC: Proper Group/PE Nesting ] applies to [51] too (see [49]) [ VC: No Duplicate Types ] The same name must not appear more than once in a single mixed-content declaration.

return.info: the list of the xmlElementContentPtr describing the element choices

arg.name: inputchk
arg.info: the input used for the current entity, needed for boundary checks

function.name: xmlParseEncName
function.info: parse the XML encoding name [81] EncName ::= [A-Za-z] ([A-Za-z0-9._] | '-')*

return.info: the encoding name value or NULL

function.name: xmlParseEncodingDecl
function.info: parse the XML encoding declaration [80] EncodingDecl ::= S 'encoding' Eq ('"' EncName '"' | "'" EncName "'") this setups the conversion filters.

return.info: the encoding value or NULL

function.name: xmlParseEndTag
function.info: parse an end of tag [42] ETag ::= '</' Name S? '>' With namespace [NS 9] ETag ::= '</' QName S? '>'

function.name: xmlParseEntity
function.info: parse an XML external entity out of context and build a tree. [78] extParsedEnt ::= TextDecl? content This correspond to a "Well Balanced" chunk

return.info: the resulting document tree

function.name: xmlParseEntityDecl
function.info: parse <!ENTITY declarations [70] EntityDecl ::= GEDecl | PEDecl [71] GEDecl ::= '<!ENTITY' S Name S EntityDef S? '>' [72] PEDecl ::= '<!ENTITY' S '%' S Name S PEDef S? '>' [73] EntityDef ::= EntityValue | (ExternalID NDataDecl?) [74] PEDef ::= EntityValue | ExternalID [76] NDataDecl ::= S 'NDATA' S Name [ VC: Notation Declared ] The Name must match the declared name of a notation.

function.name: xmlParseEntityRef
function.info: parse ENTITY references declarations [68] EntityRef ::= '&' Name ';' [ WFC: Entity Declared ] In a document without any DTD, a document with only an internal DTD subset which contains no parameter entity references, or a document with "standalone='yes'", the Name given in the entity reference must match that in an entity declaration, except that well-formed documents need not declare any of the following entities: amp, lt, gt, apos, quot. The declaration of a parameter entity must precede any reference to it. Similarly, the declaration of a general entity must precede any reference to it which appears in a default value in an attribute-list declaration. Note that if entities are declared in the external subset or in external parameter entities, a non-validating processor is not obligated to read and process their declarations; for such documents, the rule that an entity must be declared is a well-formedness constraint only if standalone='yes'. [ WFC: Parsed Entity ] An entity reference must not contain the name of an unparsed entity

return.info: the xmlEntityPtr if found, or NULL otherwise.

function.name: xmlParseEntityValue
function.info: parse a value for ENTITY declarations [9] EntityValue ::= '"' ([^%&"] | PEReference | Reference)* '"' | "'" ([^%&'] | PEReference | Reference)* "'"

return.info: the EntityValue parsed with reference substituted or NULL

arg.name: orig
arg.info: if non-NULL store a copy of the original entity value

function.name: xmlParseEnumeratedType
function.info: parse an Enumerated attribute type. [57] EnumeratedType ::= NotationType | Enumeration [58] NotationType ::= 'NOTATION' S '(' S? Name (S? '|' S? Name)* S? ')'

return.info: XML_ATTRIBUTE_ENUMERATION or XML_ATTRIBUTE_NOTATION

arg.name: tree
arg.info: the enumeration tree built while parsing

function.name: xmlParseEnumerationType
function.info: parse an Enumeration attribute type. [59] Enumeration ::= '(' S? Nmtoken (S? '|' S? Nmtoken)* S? ')' [ VC: Enumeration ] Values of this type must match one of the Nmtoken tokens in the declaration

return.info: the enumeration attribute tree built while parsing

function.name: xmlParseExtParsedEnt
function.info: parse a general parsed entity An external general parsed entity is well-formed if it matches the production labeled extParsedEnt. [78] extParsedEnt ::= TextDecl? content

return.info: 0, -1 in case of error. the parser context is augmented as a result of the parsing.

function.name: xmlParseExternalEntity
function.info: Parse an external general entity An external general parsed entity is well-formed if it matches the production labeled extParsedEnt. [78] extParsedEnt ::= TextDecl? content

return.info: 0 if the entity is well formed, -1 in case of args problem and the parser error code otherwise

arg.name: doc
arg.info: the document the chunk pertains to

arg.name: user_data
arg.info: The user data returned on SAX callbacks (possibly NULL)

arg.name: URL
arg.info: the URL for the entity to load

arg.name: ID
arg.info: the System ID for the entity to load

arg.name: lst
arg.info: the return value for the set of parsed nodes

function.name: xmlParseExternalID
function.info: Parse an External ID or a Public ID NOTE: Productions [75] and [83] interact badly since [75] can generate 'PUBLIC' S PubidLiteral S SystemLiteral [75] ExternalID ::= 'SYSTEM' S SystemLiteral | 'PUBLIC' S PubidLiteral S SystemLiteral [83] PublicID ::= 'PUBLIC' S PubidLiteral

return.info: the function returns SystemLiteral and in the second case publicID receives PubidLiteral, is strict is off it is possible to return NULL and have publicID set.

arg.name: strict
arg.info: indicate whether we should restrict parsing to only production [75], see NOTE below

function.name: xmlParseExternalSubset
function.info: parse Markup declarations from an external subset [30] extSubset ::= textDecl? extSubsetDecl [31] extSubsetDecl ::= (markupdecl | conditionalSect | PEReference | S) *

function.name: xmlParseFile
function.info: parse an XML file and build a tree. Automatic support for ZLIB/Compress compressed document is provided by default if found at compile-time.

return.info: the resulting document tree if the file was wellformed, NULL otherwise.

function.name: xmlParseInNodeContext
function.info: Parse a well-balanced chunk of an XML document within the context (DTD, namespaces, etc ...) of the given node. The allowed sequence for the data is a Well Balanced Chunk defined by the content production in the XML grammar: [43] content ::= (element | CharData | Reference | CDSect | PI | Comment)*

return.info: XML_ERR_OK if the chunk is well balanced, and the parser error code otherwise

arg.name: datalen
arg.info: the input string length in bytes

arg.name: lst
arg.info: the return value for the set of parsed nodes

function.name: xmlParseMarkupDecl
function.info: parse Markup declarations [29] markupdecl ::= elementdecl | AttlistDecl | EntityDecl | NotationDecl | PI | Comment [ VC: Proper Declaration/PE Nesting ] Parameter-entity replacement text must be properly nested with markup declarations. That is to say, if either the first character or the last character of a markup declaration (markupdecl above) is contained in the replacement text for a parameter-entity reference, both must be contained in the same replacement text. [ WFC: PEs in Internal Subset ] In the internal DTD subset, parameter-entity references can occur only where markup declarations can occur, not within markup declarations. (This does not apply to references that occur in external parameter entities or to the external subset.)

function.name: xmlParseMemory
function.info: parse an XML in-memory block and build a tree.

return.info: the resulting document tree

arg.name: buffer
arg.info: an pointer to a char array

function.name: xmlParseMisc
function.info: parse an XML Misc* optional field. [27] Misc ::= Comment | PI | S

function.name: xmlParseName
function.info: parse an XML name. [4] NameChar ::= Letter | Digit | '.' | '-' | '_' | ':' | CombiningChar | Extender [5] Name ::= (Letter | '_' | ':') (NameChar)* [6] Names ::= Name (#x20 Name)*

return.info: the Name parsed or NULL

function.name: xmlParseNamespace
function.info: xmlParseNamespace: parse specific PI '<?namespace ...' constructs. This is what the older xml-name Working Draft specified, a bunch of other stuff may still rely on it, so support is still here as if it was declared on the root of the Tree:-( TODO: remove from library To be removed at next drop of binary compatibility

function.name: xmlParseNmtoken
function.info: parse an XML Nmtoken. [7] Nmtoken ::= (NameChar)+ [8] Nmtokens ::= Nmtoken (#x20 Nmtoken)*

return.info: the Nmtoken parsed or NULL

function.name: xmlParseNotationDecl
function.info: parse a notation declaration [82] NotationDecl ::= '<!NOTATION' S Name S (ExternalID | PublicID) S? '>' Hence there is actually 3 choices: 'PUBLIC' S PubidLiteral 'PUBLIC' S PubidLiteral S SystemLiteral and 'SYSTEM' S SystemLiteral See the NOTE on xmlParseExternalID().

function.name: xmlParseNotationType
function.info: parse an Notation attribute type. Note: the leading 'NOTATION' S part has already being parsed... [58] NotationType ::= 'NOTATION' S '(' S? Name (S? '|' S? Name)* S? ')' [ VC: Notation Attributes ] Values of this type must match one of the notation names included in the declaration; all notation names in the declaration must be declared.

return.info: the notation attribute tree built while parsing

function.name: xmlParsePEReference
function.info: parse PEReference declarations The entity content is handled directly by pushing it's content as a new input stream. [69] PEReference ::= '%' Name ';' [ WFC: No Recursion ] A parsed entity must not contain a recursive reference to itself, either directly or indirectly. [ WFC: Entity Declared ] In a document without any DTD, a document with only an internal DTD subset which contains no parameter entity references, or a document with "standalone='yes'", ... ... The declaration of a parameter entity must precede any reference to it... [ VC: Entity Declared ] In a document with an external subset or external parameter entities with "standalone='no'", ... ... The declaration of a parameter entity must precede any reference to it... [ WFC: In DTD ] Parameter-entity references may only appear in the DTD. NOTE: misleading but this is handled.

function.name: xmlParsePI
function.info: parse an XML Processing Instruction. [16] PI ::= '<?' PITarget (S (Char* - (Char* '?>' Char*)))? '?>' The processing is transfered to SAX once parsed.

function.name: xmlParsePITarget
function.info: parse the name of a PI [17] PITarget ::= Name - (('X' | 'x') ('M' | 'm') ('L' | 'l'))

return.info: the PITarget name or NULL

function.name: xmlParsePubidLiteral
function.info: parse an XML public literal [12] PubidLiteral ::= '"' PubidChar* '"' | "'" (PubidChar - "'")* "'"

return.info: the PubidLiteral parsed or NULL.

function.name: xmlParseQuotedString
function.info: Parse and return a string between quotes or doublequotes TODO: Deprecated, to be removed at next drop of binary compatibility

return.info: the string parser or NULL.

function.name: xmlParseReference
function.info: parse and handle entity references in content, depending on the SAX interface, this may end-up in a call to character() if this is a CharRef, a predefined entity, if there is no reference() callback. or if the parser was asked to switch to that mode. [67] Reference ::= EntityRef | CharRef

function.name: xmlParseSDDecl
function.info: parse the XML standalone declaration [32] SDDecl ::= S 'standalone' Eq (("'" ('yes' | 'no') "'") | ('"' ('yes' | 'no')'"')) [ VC: Standalone Document Declaration ] TODO The standalone document declaration must have the value "no" if any external markup declarations contain declarations of: - attributes with default values, if elements to which these attributes apply appear in the document without specifications of values for these attributes, or - entities (other than amp, lt, gt, apos, quot), if references to those entities appear in the document, or - attributes with values subject to normalization, where the attribute appears in the document with a value which will change as a result of normalization, or - element types with element content, if white space occurs directly within any instance of those types.

return.info: 1 if standalone, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlParseStartTag
function.info: parse a start of tag either for rule element or EmptyElement. In both case we don't parse the tag closing chars. [40] STag ::= '<' Name (S Attribute)* S? '>' [ WFC: Unique Att Spec ] No attribute name may appear more than once in the same start-tag or empty-element tag. [44] EmptyElemTag ::= '<' Name (S Attribute)* S? '/>' [ WFC: Unique Att Spec ] No attribute name may appear more than once in the same start-tag or empty-element tag. With namespace: [NS 8] STag ::= '<' QName (S Attribute)* S? '>' [NS 10] EmptyElement ::= '<' QName (S Attribute)* S? '/>'

return.info: the element name parsed

function.name: xmlParseSystemLiteral
function.info: parse an XML Literal [11] SystemLiteral ::= ('"' [^"]* '"') | ("'" [^']* "'")

return.info: the SystemLiteral parsed or NULL

function.name: xmlParseTextDecl
function.info: parse an XML declaration header for external entities [77] TextDecl ::= '<?xml' VersionInfo? EncodingDecl S? '?>' Question: Seems that EncodingDecl is mandatory ? Is that a typo ?

function.name: xmlParseURI
function.info: Parse an URI URI-reference = [ absoluteURI | relativeURI ] [ "#" fragment ]

return.info: a newly built xmlURIPtr or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlParseURIReference
function.info: Parse an URI reference string and fills in the appropriate fields of the @uri structure URI-reference = [ absoluteURI | relativeURI ] [ "#" fragment ]

return.info: 0 or the error code

function.name: xmlParseVersionInfo
function.info: parse the XML version. [24] VersionInfo ::= S 'version' Eq (' VersionNum ' | " VersionNum ") [25] Eq ::= S? '=' S?

return.info: the version string, e.g. "1.0"

function.name: xmlParseVersionNum
function.info: parse the XML version value. [26] VersionNum ::= ([a-zA-Z0-9_.:] | '-')+

function.name: xmlParserHandlePEReference
function.info: [69] PEReference ::= '%' Name ';' [ WFC: No Recursion ] A parsed entity must not contain a recursive reference to itself, either directly or indirectly. [ WFC: Entity Declared ] In a document without any DTD, a document with only an internal DTD subset which contains no parameter entity references, or a document with "standalone='yes'", ... ... The declaration of a parameter entity must precede any reference to it... [ VC: Entity Declared ] In a document with an external subset or external parameter entities with "standalone='no'", ... ... The declaration of a parameter entity must precede any reference to it... [ WFC: In DTD ] Parameter-entity references may only appear in the DTD. NOTE: misleading but this is handled. A PEReference may have been detected in the current input stream the handling is done accordingly to http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml#entproc i.e. - Included in literal in entity values - Included as Parameter Entity reference within DTDs

function.name: xmlParserHandleReference
function.info: TODO: Remove, now deprecated ... the test is done directly in the content parsing routines. [67] Reference ::= EntityRef | CharRef [68] EntityRef ::= '&' Name ';' [ WFC: Entity Declared ] the Name given in the entity reference must match that in an entity declaration, except that well-formed documents need not declare any of the following entities: amp, lt, gt, apos, quot. [ WFC: Parsed Entity ] An entity reference must not contain the name of an unparsed entity [66] CharRef ::= '&#' [0-9]+ ';' | '&#x' [0-9a-fA-F]+ ';' A PEReference may have been detected in the current input stream the handling is done accordingly to http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml#entproc

function.name: xmlParserInputBufferGrow
function.info: Grow up the content of the input buffer, the old data are preserved This routine handle the I18N transcoding to internal UTF-8 This routine is used when operating the parser in normal (pull) mode TODO: one should be able to remove one extra copy by copying directly onto in->buffer or in->raw

function.name: xmlParserInputBufferPush
function.info: Push the content of the arry in the input buffer This routine handle the I18N transcoding to internal UTF-8 This is used when operating the parser in progressive (push) mode.

arg.name: len
arg.info: the size in bytes of the array.

function.name: xmlParserInputBufferRead

function.name: xmlReconciliateNs
function.info: This function checks that all the namespaces declared within the given tree are properly declared. This is needed for example after Copy or Cut and then paste operations. The subtree may still hold pointers to namespace declarations outside the subtree or invalid/masked. As much as possible the function try to reuse the existing namespaces found in the new environment. If not possible the new namespaces are redeclared on @tree at the top of the given subtree.

return.info: the number of namespace declarations created or -1 in case of error.

arg.name: tree
arg.info: a node defining the subtree to reconciliate

function.name: xmlRegExecErrInfo
function.info: Extract error informations from the regexp execution, the parameter @string will be updated with the value pushed and not accepted, the parameter @values must point to an array of @nbval string pointers on return nbval will contain the number of possible strings in that state and the @values array will be updated with them. The string values

return.info: will be freed with the @exec context and don't need to be deallocated. Returns: 0 in case of success or -1 in case of error.

arg.name: exec
arg.info: a regexp execution context generating an error

arg.name: string
arg.info: return value for the error string

arg.name: nbval
arg.info: pointer to the number of accepted values IN/OUT

arg.name: values
arg.info: pointer to the array of acceptable values

arg.name: terminal
arg.info: return value if this was a terminal state

arg.name: terminal
arg.info: return value if this was a terminal state

function.info: Is this document tagged standalone ?

return.info: 1 if true

function.name: xmlSAX2NotationDecl
function.info: What to do when a notation declaration has been parsed.

arg.name: publicId
arg.info: The public ID of the entity

arg.name: systemId
arg.info: The system ID of the entity

function.name: xmlSAX2ProcessingInstruction
function.info: A processing instruction has been parsed.

function.name: xmlSAX2Reference
function.info: called when an entity xmlSAX2Reference is detected.

function.name: xmlSAX2ResolveEntity
function.info: The entity loader, to control the loading of external entities, the application can either: - override this xmlSAX2ResolveEntity() callback in the SAX block - or better use the xmlSetExternalEntityLoader() function to set up it's own entity resolution routine

return.info: the xmlParserInputPtr if inlined or NULL for DOM behaviour.

arg.name: publicId
arg.info: The public ID of the entity

arg.name: systemId
arg.info: The system ID of the entity

function.name: xmlSAX2SetDocumentLocator
function.info: Receive the document locator at startup, actually xmlDefaultSAXLocator Everything is available on the context, so this is useless in our case.

function.name: xmlSAX2StartDocument
function.info: called when the document start being processed.

function.name: xmlSAX2StartElement
function.info: called when an opening tag has been processed.

arg.name: fullname
arg.info: The element name, including namespace prefix

arg.name: atts
arg.info: An array of name/value attributes pairs, NULL terminated

function.name: xmlSAX2StartElementNs
function.info: SAX2 callback when an element start has been detected by the parser. It provides the namespace informations for the element, as well as the new namespace declarations on the element.

arg.name: localname
arg.info: the local name of the element

arg.name: prefix
arg.info: the element namespace prefix if available

arg.name: URI
arg.info: the element namespace name if available

arg.name: nb_namespaces
arg.info: number of namespace definitions on that node

arg.name: namespaces
arg.info: pointer to the array of prefix/URI pairs namespace definitions

arg.name: nb_attributes
arg.info: the number of attributes on that node

arg.name: attributes
arg.info: pointer to the array of (localname/prefix/URI/value/end) attribute values.

function.name: xmlSAX2UnparsedEntityDecl
function.info: What to do when an unparsed entity declaration is parsed

arg.name: publicId
arg.info: The public ID of the entity

arg.name: systemId
arg.info: The system ID of the entity

function.name: xmlSAXDefaultVersion
function.info: Set the default version of SAX used globally by the library. By default, during initialization the default is set to 2. Note that it is generally a better coding style to use xmlSAXVersion() to set up the version explicitly for a given parsing context.

return.info: the previous value in case of success and -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlSAXParseDTD
function.info: Load and parse an external subset.

return.info: the resulting xmlDtdPtr or NULL in case of error.

arg.name: ExternalID
arg.info: a NAME* containing the External ID of the DTD

arg.name: SystemID
arg.info: a NAME* containing the URL to the DTD

function.name: xmlSAXParseDoc
function.info: parse an XML in-memory document and build a tree. It use the given SAX function block to handle the parsing callback. If sax is NULL, fallback to the default DOM tree building routines.

return.info: the resulting document tree

arg.name: cur
arg.info: a pointer to an array of xmlChar

arg.name: recovery
arg.info: work in recovery mode, i.e. tries to read no Well Formed documents

function.name: xmlSAXParseEntity
function.info: parse an XML external entity out of context and build a tree. It use the given SAX function block to handle the parsing callback. If sax is NULL, fallback to the default DOM tree building routines. [78] extParsedEnt ::= TextDecl? content This correspond to a "Well Balanced" chunk

return.info: the resulting document tree

function.name: xmlSAXParseFile
function.info: parse an XML file and build a tree. Automatic support for ZLIB/Compress compressed document is provided by default if found at compile-time. It use the given SAX function block to handle the parsing callback. If sax is NULL, fallback to the default DOM tree building routines.

return.info: the resulting document tree

arg.name: recovery
arg.info: work in recovery mode, i.e. tries to read no Well Formed documents

function.name: xmlSAXParseFileWithData
function.info: parse an XML file and build a tree. Automatic support for ZLIB/Compress compressed document is provided by default if found at compile-time. It use the given SAX function block to handle the parsing callback. If sax is NULL, fallback to the default DOM tree building routines. User data (void *) is stored within the parser context in the context's _private member, so it is available nearly everywhere in libxml

return.info: the resulting document tree

arg.name: recovery
arg.info: work in recovery mode, i.e. tries to read no Well Formed documents

function.name: xmlSAXParseMemory
function.info: parse an XML in-memory block and use the given SAX function block to handle the parsing callback. If sax is NULL, fallback to the default DOM tree building routines.

return.info: the resulting document tree

arg.name: buffer
arg.info: an pointer to a char array

arg.name: recovery
arg.info: work in recovery mode, i.e. tries to read not Well Formed documents

function.name: xmlSAXParseMemoryWithData
function.info: parse an XML in-memory block and use the given SAX function block to handle the parsing callback. If sax is NULL, fallback to the default DOM tree building routines. User data (void *) is stored within the parser context in the context's _private member, so it is available nearly everywhere in libxml

return.info: the resulting document tree

arg.name: buffer
arg.info: an pointer to a char array

arg.name: recovery
arg.info: work in recovery mode, i.e. tries to read no Well Formed documents

function.name: xmlSAXUserParseFile
function.info: parse an XML file and call the given SAX handler routines. Automatic support for ZLIB/Compress compressed document is provided

return.info: 0 in case of success or a error number otherwise

arg.name: user_data
arg.info: The user data returned on SAX callbacks

function.name: xmlSAXUserParseMemory
function.info: A better SAX parsing routine. parse an XML in-memory buffer and call the given SAX handler routines.

return.info: 0 in case of success or a error number otherwise

arg.name: user_data
arg.info: The user data returned on SAX callbacks

arg.name: size
arg.info: the length of the XML document in bytes

function.name: xmlSAXVersion
function.info: Initialize the default XML SAX handler according to the version

return.info: 0 in case of success and -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlSaveClose
function.info: Close a document saving context, i.e. make sure that all bytes have been output and free the associated data.

return.info: the number of byte written or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlSaveDoc
function.info: Save a full document to a saving context TODO: The function is not fully implemented yet as it does not return the byte count but 0 instead

return.info: the number of byte written or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlSaveFile
function.info: Dump an XML document to a file. Will use compression if compiled in and enabled. If @filename is "-" the stdout file is used.

return.info: the number of bytes written or -1 in case of failure.

function.name: xmlSaveFileEnc
function.info: Dump an XML document, converting it to the given encoding

return.info: the number of bytes written or -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: encoding
arg.info: the name of an encoding (or NULL)

function.name: xmlSaveFileTo
function.info: Dump an XML document to an I/O buffer. Warning ! This call xmlOutputBufferClose() on buf which is not available after this call.

return.info: the number of bytes written or -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: encoding
arg.info: the encoding if any assuming the I/O layer handles the trancoding

function.name: xmlSaveFlush
function.info: Flush a document saving context, i.e. make sure that all bytes have been output.

return.info: the number of byte written or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlSaveFormatFile
function.info: Dump an XML document to a file. Will use compression if compiled in and enabled. If @filename is "-" the stdout file is used. If @format is set then the document will be indented on output. Note that @format = 1 provide node indenting only if xmlIndentTreeOutput = 1 or xmlKeepBlanksDefault(0) was called

return.info: the number of bytes written or -1 in case of failure.

function.name: xmlSaveFormatFileEnc
function.info: Dump an XML document to a file or an URL.

return.info: the number of bytes written or -1 in case of error. Note that @format = 1 provide node indenting only if xmlIndentTreeOutput = 1 or xmlKeepBlanksDefault(0) was called

arg.name: filename
arg.info: the filename or URL to output

arg.name: encoding
arg.info: the name of the encoding to use or NULL.

function.name: xmlSaveFormatFileTo
function.info: Dump an XML document to an I/O buffer. Warning ! This call xmlOutputBufferClose() on buf which is not available after this call.

return.info: the number of bytes written or -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: encoding
arg.info: the encoding if any assuming the I/O layer handles the trancoding

function.name: xmlSaveSetAttrEscape
function.info: Set a custom escaping function to be used for text in attribute content

return.info: 0 if successful or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlSaveSetEscape
function.info: Set a custom escaping function to be used for text in element content

return.info: 0 if successful or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlSaveToFd
function.info: Create a document saving context serializing to a file descriptor with the encoding and the options given.

return.info: a new serialization context or NULL in case of error.

arg.name: encoding
arg.info: the encoding name to use or NULL

function.name: xmlSaveToFilename
function.info: Create a document saving context serializing to a filename or possibly to an URL (but this is less reliable) with the encoding and the options given.

return.info: a new serialization context or NULL in case of error.

arg.name: filename
arg.info: a file name or an URL

arg.name: encoding
arg.info: the encoding name to use or NULL

function.name: xmlSaveToIO
function.info: Create a document saving context serializing to a file descriptor with the encoding and the options given

return.info: a new serialization context or NULL in case of error.

arg.name: encoding
arg.info: the encoding name to use or NULL

function.name: xmlSaveTree
function.info: Save a subtree starting at the node parameter to a saving context TODO: The function is not fully implemented yet as it does not return the byte count but 0 instead

return.info: the number of byte written or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlSaveUri
function.info: Save the URI as an escaped string

return.info: a new string (to be deallocated by caller)

function.name: xmlScanName
function.info: Trickery: parse an XML name but without consuming the input flow Needed for rollback cases. Used only when parsing entities references. TODO: seems deprecated now, only used in the default part of xmlParserHandleReference [4] NameChar ::= Letter | Digit | '.' | '-' | '_' | ':' | CombiningChar | Extender [5] Name ::= (Letter | '_' | ':') (NameChar)* [6] Names ::= Name (S Name)*

return.info: the Name parsed or NULL

function.name: xmlSchemaCheckFacet
function.info: Checks and computes the values of facets.

return.info: 0 if valid, a positive error code if not valid and -1 in case of an internal or API error.

arg.name: pctxt
arg.info: the schema parser context or NULL

arg.name: name
arg.info: the optional name of the type

function.name: xmlSchemaCleanupTypes
function.info: Cleanup the default XML Schemas type library

function.name: xmlSchemaCollapseString
function.info: Removes and normalize white spaces in the string

return.info: the new string or NULL if no change was required.

function.name: xmlSchemaCompareValues
function.info: Compare 2 values

return.info: -1 if x < y, 0 if x == y, 1 if x > y, 2 if x <> y, and -2 in case of error

function.name: xmlSchemaCompareValuesWhtsp
function.info: Compare 2 values

return.info: -1 if x < y, 0 if x == y, 1 if x > y, 2 if x <> y, and -2 in case of error

function.name: xmlSchemaCopyValue
function.info: Copies the precomputed value. This duplicates any string within.

return.info: the copy or NULL if a copy for a data-type is not implemented.

arg.name: val
arg.info: the precomputed value to be copied

function.name: xmlSchemaDump
function.info: Dump a Schema structure.

function.name: xmlSchemaFree
function.info: Deallocate a Schema structure.

function.info: Deallocate a Schema Facet structure.

function.info: Free the resources associated to the schema parser context

function.name: xmlSchemaFreeType
function.info: Deallocate a Schema Type structure.

function.name: xmlSchemaFreeValidCtxt
function.info: Free the resources associated to the schema validation context

function.name: xmlSchemaFreeValue
function.info: Cleanup the default XML Schemas type library

function.name: xmlSchemaFreeWildcard
function.info: Deallocates a wildcard structure.

function.name: xmlSchemaGetBuiltInListSimpleTypeItemType
function.info: Lookup function

return.info: the item type of @type as defined by the built-in datatype hierarchy of XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes, or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: xmlSchemaGetBuiltInType
function.info: Gives you the type struct for a built-in type by its type id.

return.info: the type if found, NULL otherwise.

arg.name: type
arg.info: the type of the built in type

function.name: xmlSchemaGetCanonValue
function.info: Get a the cononical lexical representation of the value. The caller has to FREE the returned retValue. WARNING: Some value types are not supported yet, resulting in a @retValue of "???". TODO: XML Schema 1.0 does not define canonical representations for: duration, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonthDay, gMonth, gDay, anyURI, QName, NOTATION. This will be fixed in XML Schema 1.1.

return.info: 0 if the value could be built, 1 if the value type is not supported yet and -1 in case of API errors.

function.name: xmlSchemaGetCanonValueWhtsp
function.info: Get a the cononical representation of the value. The caller has to free the returned @retValue.

return.info: 0 if the value could be built, 1 if the value type is not supported yet and -1 in case of API errors.

arg.name: ws
arg.info: the whitespace type of the value

function.name: xmlSchemaGetFacetValueAsULong
function.info: Extract the value of a facet

return.info: the value as a long

function.name: xmlSchemaGetParserErrors
function.info: Get the callback information used to handle errors for a parser context

return.info: -1 in case of failure, 0 otherwise

arg.info: contextual data for the callbacks result

return.info: the type if found, NULL otherwise

arg.info: the URI of the namespace usually "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"

function.info: Accessor for the type of a value

function.name: xmlSchemaGetValidErrors
function.info: Get the error and warning callback informations

return.info: -1 in case of error and 0 otherwise

function.info: Initialize the default XML Schemas type library

function.info: Evaluates if a specific facet can be used in conjunction with a type.

return.info: 1 if the facet can be used with the given built-in type, 0 otherwise and -1 in case the type is not a built-in type.

function.name: xmlSchemaIsValid
function.info: Check if any error was detected during validation.

return.info: 1 if valid so far, 0 if errors were detected, and -1 in case of internal error.

function.name: xmlSchemaNewDocParserCtxt
function.info: Create an XML Schemas parse context for that document. NB. The document may be modified during the parsing process.

return.info: the parser context or NULL in case of error

function.info: Allocate a new Facet structure.

return.info: the newly allocated structure or NULL in case or error
