arg.info: a pointer to a char array containing the schemas

function.name: xmlSchemaNewNOTATIONValue
function.info: Allocate a new NOTATION value. The given values are consumed and freed with the struct.

return.info: a pointer to the new value or NULL in case of error

arg.name: ns
arg.info: the notation namespace name or NULL

function.name: xmlSchemaNewParserCtxt
function.info: Create an XML Schemas parse context for that file/resource expected to contain an XML Schemas file.

return.info: the parser context or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlSchemaNewQNameValue
function.info: Allocate a new QName value. The given values are consumed and freed with the struct.

return.info: a pointer to the new value or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: xmlSchemaNewStringValue
function.info: Allocate a new simple type value. The type can be of XML_SCHEMAS_STRING. WARNING: This one is intended to be expanded for other string based types. We need this for anySimpleType as well. The given value is consumed and freed with the struct.

return.info: a pointer to the new value or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlSchemaNewValidCtxt
function.info: Create an XML Schemas validation context based on the given schema.

return.info: the validation context or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlSchemaParse
function.info: parse a schema definition resource and build an internal XML Shema struture which can be used to validate instances. *WARNING* this interface is highly subject to change

return.info: the internal XML Schema structure built from the resource or NULL in case of error

function.name: xmlSchemaSAXPlug
function.info: Plug a SAX based validation layer in a SAX parsing event flow. The original @saxptr and @dataptr data are replaced by new pointers but the calls to the original will be maintained.

return.info: a pointer to a data structure needed to unplug the validation layer or NULL in case of errors.

arg.name: sax
arg.info: a pointer to the original xmlSAXHandlerPtr

arg.name: user_data
arg.info: a pointer to the original SAX user data pointer

function.name: xmlSchemaSAXUnplug
function.info: Unplug a SAX based validation layer in a SAX parsing event flow. The original pointers used in the call are restored.

return.info: 0 in case of success and -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: plug
arg.info: a data structure returned by xmlSchemaSAXPlug

function.name: xmlSchemaSetParserErrors
function.info: Set the callback functions used to handle errors for a validation context

function.name: xmlSchemaSetValidErrors
function.info: Set the error and warning callback informations

function.name: xmlSchemaSetValidOptions
function.info: Sets the options to be used during the validation.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of an API error.

function.name: xmlSchemaValPredefTypeNode
function.info: Check that a value conforms to the lexical space of the predefined type. if true a value is computed and returned in @val.

return.info: 0 if this validates, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

function.name: xmlSchemaValPredefTypeNodeNoNorm
function.info: Check that a value conforms to the lexical space of the predefined type. if true a value is computed and returned in @val. This one does apply any normalization to the value.

return.info: 0 if this validates, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

function.name: xmlSchemaValidCtxtGetOptions
function.info: Get the validation context options.

return.info: the option combination or -1 on error.

function.name: xmlSchemaValidateDoc
function.info: Validate a document tree in memory.

return.info: 0 if the document is schemas valid, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

function.name: xmlSchemaValidateFacet
function.info: Check a value against a facet condition

return.info: 0 if the element is schemas valid, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

arg.name: value
arg.info: the lexical repr of the value to validate

function.name: xmlSchemaValidateFacetWhtsp
function.info: Check a value against a facet condition. This takes value normalization according to the specified whitespace types into account. Note that @value needs to be the *normalized* value if the facet is of type "pattern".

return.info: 0 if the element is schemas valid, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

arg.name: fws
arg.info: the whitespace type of the facet's value

arg.name: valType
arg.info: the built-in type of the value

arg.name: value
arg.info: the lexical (or normalized for pattern) repr of the value to validate

arg.name: ws
arg.info: the whitespace type of the value

function.name: xmlSchemaValidateFile
function.info: Do a schemas validation of the given resource, it will use the SAX streamable validation internally.

return.info: 0 if the document is valid, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of an internal or API error.

arg.name: options
arg.info: a future set of options, currently unused

function.info: Checka a value against a "length", "minLength" and "maxLength" facet; sets @length to the computed length of @value.

arg.info: the lexical repr. of the value to be validated

arg.name: length
arg.info: the actual length of the value

function.name: xmlSchemaValidateLengthFacetWhtsp
function.info: Checka a value against a "length", "minLength" and "maxLength" facet; sets @length to the computed length of @value.

return.info: 0 if the value is valid, a positive error code otherwise and -1 in case of an internal or API error.

arg.name: value
arg.info: the lexical repr. of the value to be validated

arg.name: length
arg.info: the actual length of the value

arg.name: ws
arg.info: the whitespace type of the value

function.name: xmlSchemaValidateListSimpleTypeFacet
function.info: Checks the value of a list simple type against a facet.

return.info: 0 if the value is valid, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of an internal error.

arg.name: value
arg.info: the lexical repr of the value to validate

arg.name: expectedLen
arg.info: the resulting expected number of list items

function.name: xmlSchemaValidateOneElement
function.info: Validate a branch of a tree, starting with the given @elem.

return.info: 0 if the element and its subtree is valid, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of an internal or API error.

function.name: xmlSchemaValidatePredefinedType
function.info: Check that a value conforms to the lexical space of the predefined type. if true a value is computed and returned in @val.

return.info: 0 if this validates, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

function.name: xmlSchemaValidateStream
function.info: Validate an input based on a flow of SAX event from the parser and forward the events to the @sax handler with the provided @user_data the user provided @sax handler must be a SAX2 one.

return.info: 0 if the document is schemas valid, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

arg.name: input
arg.info: the input to use for reading the data

arg.name: sax
arg.info: a SAX handler for the resulting events

arg.name: user_data
arg.info: the context to provide to the SAX handler.

function.name: xmlSchemaValueAppend
function.info: Appends a next sibling to a list of computed values.

return.info: 0 if succeeded and -1 on API errors.

function.name: xmlSchemaValueGetAsBoolean
function.info: Accessor for the boolean value of a computed value.

return.info: 1 if true and 0 if false, or in case of an error. Hmm.

function.name: xmlSchemaValueGetAsString
function.info: Accessor for the string value of a computed value.

return.info: the string value or NULL if there was none, or on API errors.

function.name: xmlSchemaValueGetNext
function.info: Accessor for the next sibling of a list of computed values.

return.info: the next value or NULL if there was none, or on API errors.

function.name: xmlSchemaWhiteSpaceReplace
function.info: Replaces 0xd, 0x9 and 0xa with a space.

return.info: the new string or NULL if no change was required.

function.name: xmlSearchNs
function.info: Search a Ns registered under a given name space for a document. recurse on the parents until it finds the defined namespace or return NULL otherwise. @nameSpace can be NULL, this is a search for the default namespace. We don't allow to cross entities boundaries. If you don't declare the namespace within those you will be in troubles !!! A warning is generated to cover this case.

return.info: the namespace pointer or NULL.

function.name: xmlSearchNsByHref
function.info: Search a Ns aliasing a given URI. Recurse on the parents until it finds the defined namespace or return NULL otherwise.

return.info: the namespace pointer or NULL.

function.name: xmlSetBufferAllocationScheme
function.info: Set the buffer allocation method. Types are XML_BUFFER_ALLOC_EXACT - use exact sizes, keeps memory usage down XML_BUFFER_ALLOC_DOUBLEIT - double buffer when extra needed, improves performance

function.name: xmlSetCompressMode
function.info: set the default compression mode used, ZLIB based Correct values: 0 (uncompressed) to 9 (max compression)

function.name: xmlSetDocCompressMode
function.info: set the compression ratio for a document, ZLIB based Correct values: 0 (uncompressed) to 9 (max compression)

function.name: xmlSetEntityReferenceFunc
function.info: Set the function to call call back when a xml reference has been made

function.name: xmlSetExternalEntityLoader
function.info: Changes the defaultexternal entity resolver function for the application

function.name: xmlSetFeature
function.info: Change the current value of one feature of this parser instance

return.info: -1 in case or error, 0 otherwise

arg.name: value
arg.info: pointer to the location of the new value

function.name: xmlSetGenericErrorFunc
function.info: Function to reset the handler and the error context for out of context error messages. This simply means that @handler will be called for subsequent error messages while not parsing nor validating. And @ctx will be passed as first argument to @handler One can simply force messages to be emitted to another FILE * than stderr by setting @ctx to this file handle and @handler to NULL. For multi-threaded applications, this must be set separately for each thread.

function.name: xmlSetListDoc
function.info: update all nodes in the list to point to the right document

function.name: xmlSetNs
function.info: Associate a namespace to a node, a posteriori.

function.name: xmlSetNsProp
function.info: Set (or reset) an attribute carried by a node. The ns structure must be in scope, this is not checked.

return.info: the attribute pointer.

function.name: xmlSetProp
function.info: Set (or reset) an attribute carried by a node.

return.info: the attribute pointer.

function.name: xmlSetStructuredErrorFunc
function.info: Function to reset the handler and the error context for out of context structured error messages. This simply means that @handler will be called for subsequent error messages while not parsing nor validating. And @ctx will be passed as first argument to @handler For multi-threaded applications, this must be set separately for each thread.

function.name: xmlSetTreeDoc
function.info: update all nodes under the tree to point to the right document

function.name: xmlSetupParserForBuffer
function.info: Setup the parser context to parse a new buffer; Clears any prior contents from the parser context. The buffer parameter must not be NULL, but the filename parameter can be

function.name: xmlShell
function.info: Implements the XML shell This allow to load, validate, view, modify and save a document using a environment similar to a UNIX commandline.

arg.name: output
arg.info: the output FILE*, defaults to stdout if NULL

function.name: xmlShellBase
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "base" dumps the current XML base of the node

function.name: xmlShellCat
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "cat" dumps the serialization node content (XML or HTML).

functype.name: xmlShellCmd
functype.info: This is a generic signature for the XML shell functions.

return.info: an int, negative returns indicating errors.

function.name: xmlShellDir
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "dir" dumps informations about the node (namespace, attributes, content).

function.name: xmlShellDu
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "du" show the structure of the subtree under node @tree If @tree is null, the command works on the current node.

return.info: 0 or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlShellList
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "ls" Does an Unix like listing of the given node (like a directory)

function.name: xmlShellLoad
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "load" loads a new document specified by the filename

return.info: 0 or -1 if loading failed

function.name: xmlShellPrintNode
function.info: Print node to the output FILE

arg.name: node
arg.info: a non-null node to print to the output FILE

function.name: xmlShellPrintXPathError
function.info: Print the xpath error to libxml default error channel

arg.name: arg
arg.info: the argument that cause xpath to fail

function.name: xmlShellPrintXPathResult
function.info: Prints result to the output FILE

arg.name: list
arg.info: a valid result generated by an xpath evaluation

function.name: xmlShellPwd
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "pwd" Show the full path from the root to the node, if needed building thumblers when similar elements exists at a given ancestor level. The output is compatible with XPath commands.

return.info: 0 or -1 in case of error

functype.name: xmlShellReadlineFunc
functype.info: This is a generic signature for the XML shell input function.

return.info: a string which will be freed by the Shell.

function.name: xmlShellSave
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "save" Write the current document to the filename, or it's original name

return.info: 0 or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlShellValidate
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "validate" Validate the document, if a DTD path is provided, then the validation is done against the given DTD.

return.info: 0 or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlShellWrite
function.info: Implements the XML shell function "write" Write the current node to the filename, it saves the serialization of the subtree under the @node specified

return.info: 0 or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlSkipBlankChars
function.info: skip all blanks character found at that point in the input streams. It pops up finished entities in the process if allowable at that point.

return.info: the number of space chars skipped

function.name: xmlSnprintfElementContent
function.info: This will dump the content of the element content definition Intended just for the debug routine

arg.name: englob
arg.info: 1 if one must print the englobing parenthesis, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlSplitQName
function.info: parse an UTF8 encoded XML qualified name string [NS 5] QName ::= (Prefix ':')? LocalPart [NS 6] Prefix ::= NCName [NS 7] LocalPart ::= NCName

return.info: the local part, and prefix is updated to get the Prefix if any.

function.name: xmlSplitQName2
function.info: parse an XML qualified name string [NS 5] QName ::= (Prefix ':')? LocalPart [NS 6] Prefix ::= NCName [NS 7] LocalPart ::= NCName

return.info: NULL if not a QName, otherwise the local part, and prefix is updated to get the Prefix if any.

function.name: xmlSplitQName3
function.info: parse an XML qualified name string,i

return.info: NULL if it is not a Qualified Name, otherwise, update len with the lenght in byte of the prefix and return a pointer

function.name: xmlSprintfElementContent
function.info: Deprecated, unsafe, use xmlSnprintfElementContent

arg.name: englob
arg.info: 1 if one must print the englobing parenthesis, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlStopParser
function.info: Blocks further parser processing

function.name: xmlStrEqual
function.info: Check if both string are equal of have same content Should be a bit more readable and faster than xmlStrEqual()

return.info: 1 if they are equal, 0 if they are different

function.name: xmlStrPrintf
function.info: Formats @msg and places result into @buf.

return.info: the number of characters written to @buf or -1 if an error occurs.

function.name: xmlStrQEqual
function.info: Check if a QName is Equal to a given string

return.info: 1 if they are equal, 0 if they are different

function.name: xmlStrVPrintf
function.info: Formats @msg and places result into @buf.

return.info: the number of characters written to @buf or -1 if an error occurs.

function.name: xmlStrcasecmp
function.info: a strcasecmp for xmlChar's

return.info: the integer result of the comparison

function.name: xmlStrcasestr
function.info: a case-ignoring strstr for xmlChar's

return.info: the xmlChar * for the first occurrence or NULL.

function.name: xmlStrcat
function.info: a strcat for array of xmlChar's. Since they are supposed to be encoded in UTF-8 or an encoding with 8bit based chars, we assume a termination mark of '0'.

return.info: a new xmlChar * containing the concatenated string.

function.name: xmlStrchr
function.info: a strchr for xmlChar's

return.info: the xmlChar * for the first occurrence or NULL.

function.name: xmlStrcmp
function.info: a strcmp for xmlChar's

return.info: the integer result of the comparison

function.name: xmlStrdup
function.info: a strdup for array of xmlChar's. Since they are supposed to be encoded in UTF-8 or an encoding with 8bit based chars, we assume a termination mark of '0'.

return.info: a new xmlChar * or NULL

functype.name: xmlStrdupFunc
functype.info: Signature for an strdup() implementation.

return.info: the copy of the string or NULL in case of error.

function.name: xmlStreamPop
function.info: push one level from the stream.

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 otherwise.

function.name: xmlStreamPush
function.info: Push new data onto the stream. NOTE: if the call xmlPatterncompile() indicated a dictionary, then strings for name and ns will be expected to come from the dictionary. Both @name and @ns being NULL means the / i.e. the root of the document. This can also act as a reset.

return.info: -1 in case of error, 1 if the current state in the stream is a match and 0 otherwise.

function.name: xmlStreamPushAttr
function.info: Push new attribute data onto the stream. NOTE: if the call xmlPatterncompile() indicated a dictionary, then strings for name and ns will be expected to come from the dictionary. Both @name and @ns being NULL means the / i.e. the root of the document. This can also act as a reset.

return.info: -1 in case of error, 1 if the current state in the stream is a match and 0 otherwise.

function.name: xmlStringCurrentChar
function.info: The current char value, if using UTF-8 this may actually span multiple bytes in the input buffer.

return.info: the current char value and its length

arg.name: cur
arg.info: pointer to the beginning of the char

arg.name: len
arg.info: pointer to the length of the char read

function.name: xmlStringDecodeEntities
function.info: Takes a entity string content and process to do the adequate substitutions. [67] Reference ::= EntityRef | CharRef [69] PEReference ::= '%' Name ';'

return.info: A newly allocated string with the substitution done. The caller must deallocate it !

arg.name: end
arg.info: an end marker xmlChar, 0 if none

arg.name: end2
arg.info: an end marker xmlChar, 0 if none

arg.name: end3
arg.info: an end marker xmlChar, 0 if none

function.name: xmlStringGetNodeList
function.info: Parse the value string and build the node list associated. Should produce a flat tree with only TEXTs and ENTITY_REFs.

return.info: a pointer to the first child

function.name: xmlStringLenDecodeEntities
function.info: Takes a entity string content and process to do the adequate substitutions. [67] Reference ::= EntityRef | CharRef [69] PEReference ::= '%' Name ';'

return.info: A newly allocated string with the substitution done. The caller must deallocate it !

arg.name: end
arg.info: an end marker xmlChar, 0 if none

arg.name: end2
arg.info: an end marker xmlChar, 0 if none

arg.name: end3
arg.info: an end marker xmlChar, 0 if none

function.name: xmlStringLenGetNodeList
function.info: Parse the value string and build the node list associated. Should produce a flat tree with only TEXTs and ENTITY_REFs.

return.info: a pointer to the first child

arg.name: len
arg.info: the length of the string value

function.name: xmlStrlen
function.info: length of a xmlChar's string

return.info: the number of xmlChar contained in the ARRAY.

function.name: xmlStrncasecmp
function.info: a strncasecmp for xmlChar's

return.info: the integer result of the comparison

function.name: xmlStrncat
function.info: a strncat for array of xmlChar's, it will extend @cur with the len first bytes of @add.

return.info: a new xmlChar *, the original @cur is reallocated if needed and should not be freed

function.name: xmlStrncatNew
function.info: same as xmlStrncat, but creates a new string. The original two strings are not freed.

return.info: a new xmlChar * or NULL

function.name: xmlStrncmp
function.info: a strncmp for xmlChar's

return.info: the integer result of the comparison

function.name: xmlStrndup
function.info: a strndup for array of xmlChar's

return.info: a new xmlChar * or NULL

function.name: xmlStrstr
function.info: a strstr for xmlChar's

return.info: the xmlChar * for the first occurrence or NULL.

function.name: xmlStrsub
function.info: Extract a substring of a given string

return.info: the xmlChar * for the first occurrence or NULL.

arg.name: start
arg.info: the index of the first char (zero based)

functype.name: xmlStructuredErrorFunc
functype.info: Signature of the function to use when there is an error and the module handles the new error reporting mechanism.

arg.name: userData
arg.info: user provided data for the error callback

function.name: xmlSubstituteEntitiesDefault
function.info: Set and return the previous value for default entity support. Initially the parser always keep entity references instead of substituting entity values in the output. This function has to be used to change the default parser behavior SAX::substituteEntities() has to be used for changing that on a file by file basis.

return.info: the last value for 0 for no substitution, 1 for substitution.

function.name: xmlSwitchEncoding
function.info: change the input functions when discovering the character encoding of a given entity.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 otherwise

function.name: xmlSwitchInputEncoding
function.info: change the input functions when discovering the character encoding of a given entity.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 otherwise

function.name: xmlSwitchToEncoding
function.info: change the input functions when discovering the character encoding of a given entity.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 otherwise

function.name: xmlTextConcat
function.info: Concat the given string at the end of the existing node content

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlTextMerge
function.info: Merge two text nodes into one

return.info: the first text node augmented

arg.name: second
arg.info: the second text node being merged

function.name: xmlTextReaderAttributeCount
function.info: Provides the number of attributes of the current node

return.info: 0 i no attributes, -1 in case of error or the attribute count

function.name: xmlTextReaderBaseUri
function.info: The base URI of the node.

return.info: the base URI or NULL if not available

function.name: xmlTextReaderByteConsumed
function.info: This function provides the current index of the parser used by the reader, relative to the start of the current entity. This function actually just wraps a call to xmlBytesConsumed() for the parser context associated with the reader. See xmlBytesConsumed() for more information.

return.info: the index in bytes from the beginning of the entity or -1 in case the index could not be computed.

function.name: xmlTextReaderClose
function.info: This method releases any resources allocated by the current instance changes the state to Closed and close any underlying input.

return.info: 0 or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstBaseUri
function.info: The base URI of the node.

return.info: the base URI or NULL if not available, the string will be deallocated with the reader

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstEncoding
function.info: Determine the encoding of the document being read.

return.info: a string containing the encoding of the document or NULL in case of error. The string is deallocated with the reader.

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstLocalName
function.info: The local name of the node.

return.info: the local name or NULL if not available, the string will be deallocated with the reader.

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstName
function.info: The qualified name of the node, equal to Prefix :LocalName.

return.info: the local name or NULL if not available, the string is deallocated with the reader.

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstNamespaceUri
function.info: The URI defining the namespace associated with the node.

return.info: the namespace URI or NULL if not available, the string will be deallocated with the reader

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstPrefix
function.info: A shorthand reference to the namespace associated with the node.

return.info: the prefix or NULL if not available, the string is deallocated with the reader.

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstString
function.info: Get an interned string from the reader, allows for example to speedup string name comparisons

return.info: an interned copy of the string or NULL in case of error. The string will be deallocated with the reader.

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstValue
function.info: Provides the text value of the node if present

return.info: the string or NULL if not available. The result will be deallocated on the next Read() operation.

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstXmlLang
function.info: The xml:lang scope within which the node resides.

return.info: the xml:lang value or NULL if none exists.

function.name: xmlTextReaderConstXmlVersion
function.info: Determine the XML version of the document being read.

return.info: a string containing the XML version of the document or NULL in case of error. The string is deallocated with the reader.

function.name: xmlTextReaderCurrentDoc
function.info: Hacking interface allowing to get the xmlDocPtr correponding to the current document being accessed by the xmlTextReader. NOTE: as a result of this call, the reader will not destroy the associated XML document and calling xmlFreeDoc() on the result is needed once the reader parsing has finished.

return.info: the xmlDocPtr or NULL in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderCurrentNode
function.info: Hacking interface allowing to get the xmlNodePtr correponding to the current node being accessed by the xmlTextReader. This is dangerous because the underlying node may be destroyed on the next Reads.

return.info: the xmlNodePtr or NULL in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderDepth
function.info: The depth of the node in the tree.

return.info: the depth or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderExpand
function.info: Reads the contents of the current node and the full subtree. It then makes the subtree available until the next xmlTextReaderRead() call

return.info: a node pointer valid until the next xmlTextReaderRead() call or NULL in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderGetAttribute
function.info: Provides the value of the attribute with the specified qualified name.

return.info: a string containing the value of the specified attribute, or NULL in case of error. The string must be deallocated by the caller.

arg.name: name
arg.info: the qualified name of the attribute.

function.name: xmlTextReaderGetAttributeNo
function.info: Provides the value of the attribute with the specified index relative to the containing element.

return.info: a string containing the value of the specified attribute, or NULL in case of error. The string must be deallocated by the caller.

arg.name: no
arg.info: the zero-based index of the attribute relative to the containing element

function.name: xmlTextReaderGetAttributeNs
function.info: Provides the value of the specified attribute

return.info: a string containing the value of the specified attribute, or NULL in case of error. The string must be deallocated by the caller.

arg.name: localName
arg.info: the local name of the attribute.

arg.name: namespaceURI
arg.info: the namespace URI of the attribute.

function.name: xmlTextReaderGetErrorHandler
function.info: Retrieve the error callback function and user argument.

arg.name: f
arg.info: the callback function or NULL is no callback has been registered

function.name: xmlTextReaderGetParserColumnNumber
function.info: Provide the column number of the current parsing point.

return.info: an int or 0 if not available

function.name: xmlTextReaderGetParserLineNumber
function.info: Provide the line number of the current parsing point.

return.info: an int or 0 if not available

function.name: xmlTextReaderGetParserProp
function.info: Read the parser internal property.

return.info: the value, usually 0 or 1, or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderGetRemainder
function.info: Method to get the remainder of the buffered XML. this method stops the parser, set its state to End Of File and return the input stream with what is left that the parser did not use. The implementation is not good, the parser certainly procgressed past what's left in reader->input, and there is an allocation problem. Best would be to rewrite it differently.

return.info: the xmlParserInputBufferPtr attached to the XML or NULL in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderHasAttributes
function.info: Whether the node has attributes.

return.info: 1 if true, 0 if false, and -1 in case or error

function.name: xmlTextReaderHasValue
function.info: Whether the node can have a text value.

return.info: 1 if true, 0 if false, and -1 in case or error

function.name: xmlTextReaderIsDefault
function.info: Whether an Attribute node was generated from the default value defined in the DTD or schema.

return.info: 0 if not defaulted, 1 if defaulted, and -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderIsEmptyElement
function.info: Check if the current node is empty

return.info: 1 if empty, 0 if not and -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderIsNamespaceDecl
function.info: Determine whether the current node is a namespace declaration rather than a regular attribute.

return.info: 1 if the current node is a namespace declaration, 0 if it is a regular attribute or other type of node, or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderIsValid
function.info: Retrieve the validity status from the parser context

return.info: the flag value 1 if valid, 0 if no, and -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderLocalName
function.info: The local name of the node.

return.info: the local name or NULL if not available

function.name: xmlTextReaderLocatorBaseURI
function.info: Obtain the base URI for the given locator.

return.info: the base URI or NULL in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderLocatorLineNumber
function.info: Obtain the line number for the given locator.

return.info: the line number or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderLookupNamespace
function.info: Resolves a namespace prefix in the scope of the current element.

return.info: a string containing the namespace URI to which the prefix maps or NULL in case of error. The string must be deallocated by the caller.

arg.name: prefix
arg.info: the prefix whose namespace URI is to be resolved. To return the default namespace, specify NULL

function.name: xmlTextReaderMoveToAttribute
function.info: Moves the position of the current instance to the attribute with the specified qualified name.

return.info: 1 in case of success, -1 in case of error, 0 if not found

arg.name: name
arg.info: the qualified name of the attribute.

function.name: xmlTextReaderMoveToAttributeNo
function.info: Moves the position of the current instance to the attribute with the specified index relative to the containing element.

return.info: 1 in case of success, -1 in case of error, 0 if not found

arg.name: no
arg.info: the zero-based index of the attribute relative to the containing element.

function.name: xmlTextReaderMoveToAttributeNs
function.info: Moves the position of the current instance to the attribute with the specified local name and namespace URI.

return.info: 1 in case of success, -1 in case of error, 0 if not found

arg.name: localName
arg.info: the local name of the attribute.

arg.name: namespaceURI
arg.info: the namespace URI of the attribute.

function.name: xmlTextReaderMoveToElement
function.info: Moves the position of the current instance to the node that contains the current Attribute node.

return.info: 1 in case of success, -1 in case of error, 0 if not moved

function.name: xmlTextReaderMoveToFirstAttribute
function.info: Moves the position of the current instance to the first attribute associated with the current node.

return.info: 1 in case of success, -1 in case of error, 0 if not found

function.name: xmlTextReaderMoveToNextAttribute
function.info: Moves the position of the current instance to the next attribute associated with the current node.

return.info: 1 in case of success, -1 in case of error, 0 if not found

function.name: xmlTextReaderName
function.info: The qualified name of the node, equal to Prefix :LocalName.

return.info: the local name or NULL if not available

function.name: xmlTextReaderNamespaceUri
function.info: The URI defining the namespace associated with the node.

return.info: the namespace URI or NULL if not available

function.name: xmlTextReaderNext
function.info: Skip to the node following the current one in document order while avoiding the subtree if any.

return.info: 1 if the node was read successfully, 0 if there is no more nodes to read, or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderNextSibling
function.info: Skip to the node following the current one in document order while avoiding the subtree if any. Currently implemented only for Readers built on a document

return.info: 1 if the node was read successfully, 0 if there is no more nodes to read, or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderNodeType
function.info: Get the node type of the current node Reference: http://dotgnu.org/pnetlib-doc/System/Xml/XmlNodeType.html

return.info: the xmlNodeType of the current node or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderNormalization
function.info: The value indicating whether to normalize white space and attribute values. Since attribute value and end of line normalizations are a MUST in the XML specification only the value true is accepted. The broken bahaviour of accepting out of range character entities like � is of course not supported either.

return.info: 1 or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderPrefix
function.info: A shorthand reference to the namespace associated with the node.

return.info: the prefix or NULL if not available

function.name: xmlTextReaderPreserve
function.info: This tells the XML Reader to preserve the current node. The caller must also use xmlTextReaderCurrentDoc() to keep an handle on the resulting document once parsing has finished

return.info: the xmlNodePtr or NULL in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderPreservePattern
function.info: This tells the XML Reader to preserve all nodes matched by the pattern. The caller must also use xmlTextReaderCurrentDoc() to keep an handle on the resulting document once parsing has finished

return.info: a positive number in case of success and -1 in case of error

arg.name: namespaces
arg.info: the prefix definitions, array of [URI, prefix] or NULL

function.name: xmlTextReaderQuoteChar
function.info: The quotation mark character used to enclose the value of an attribute.

return.info: " or ' and -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderRead
function.info: Moves the position of the current instance to the next node in the stream, exposing its properties.

return.info: 1 if the node was read successfully, 0 if there is no more nodes to read, or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderReadAttributeValue
function.info: Parses an attribute value into one or more Text and EntityReference nodes.

return.info: 1 in case of success, 0 if the reader was not positionned on an ttribute node or all the attribute values have been read, or -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderReadInnerXml
function.info: Reads the contents of the current node, including child nodes and markup.

return.info: a string containing the XML content, or NULL if the current node is neither an element nor attribute, or has no child nodes. The string must be deallocated by the caller.

function.name: xmlTextReaderReadOuterXml
function.info: Reads the contents of the current node, including child nodes and markup.

return.info: a string containing the XML content, or NULL if the current node is neither an element nor attribute, or has no child nodes. The string must be deallocated by the caller.

function.name: xmlTextReaderReadState
function.info: Gets the read state of the reader.

return.info: the state value, or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderReadString
function.info: Reads the contents of an element or a text node as a string.

return.info: a string containing the contents of the Element or Text node, or NULL if the reader is positioned on any other type of node. The string must be deallocated by the caller.

function.name: xmlTextReaderRelaxNGSetSchema
function.info: Use RelaxNG to validate the document as it is processed. Activation is only possible before the first Read(). if @schema is NULL, then RelaxNG validation is desactivated. @ The @schema should not be freed until the reader is deallocated or its use has been deactivated.

return.info: 0 in case the RelaxNG validation could be (des)activated and -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderRelaxNGValidate
function.info: Use RelaxNG to validate the document as it is processed. Activation is only possible before the first Read(). if @rng is NULL, then RelaxNG validation is desactivated.

return.info: 0 in case the RelaxNG validation could be (des)activated and -1 in case of error.

arg.name: rng
arg.info: the path to a RelaxNG schema or NULL

function.name: xmlTextReaderSchemaValidate
function.info: Use W3C XSD schema to validate the document as it is processed. Activation is only possible before the first Read(). if @xsd is NULL, then RelaxNG validation is desactivated.

return.info: 0 in case the schemas validation could be (des)activated and -1 in case of error.

arg.name: xsd
arg.info: the path to a W3C XSD schema or NULL

function.name: xmlTextReaderSetErrorHandler
function.info: Register a callback function that will be called on error and warnings. If @f is NULL, the default error and warning handlers are restored.

arg.name: f
arg.info: the callback function to call on error and warnings

arg.name: arg
arg.info: a user argument to pass to the callback function

function.name: xmlTextReaderSetParserProp
function.info: Change the parser processing behaviour by changing some of its internal properties. Note that some properties can only be changed before any read has been done.

return.info: 0 if the call was successful, or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextReaderSetSchema
function.info: Use XSD Schema to validate the document as it is processed. Activation is only possible before the first Read(). if @schema is NULL, then Schema validation is desactivated. @ The @schema should not be freed until the reader is deallocated or its use has been deactivated.

return.info: 0 in case the Schema validation could be (des)activated and -1 in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderSetStructuredErrorHandler
function.info: Register a callback function that will be called on error and warnings. If @f is NULL, the default error and warning handlers are restored.

arg.name: f
arg.info: the callback function to call on error and warnings

arg.name: arg
arg.info: a user argument to pass to the callback function

function.name: xmlTextReaderStandalone
function.info: Determine the standalone status of the document being read.

return.info: 1 if the document was declared to be standalone, 0 if it was declared to be not standalone, or -1 if the document did not specify its standalone status or in case of error.

function.name: xmlTextReaderValue
function.info: Provides the text value of the node if present

return.info: the string or NULL if not available. The result must be deallocated with xmlFree()

function.name: xmlTextReaderXmlLang
function.info: The xml:lang scope within which the node resides.

return.info: the xml:lang value or NULL if none exists.

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndAttribute
function.info: End the current xml element.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndCDATA
function.info: End an xml CDATA section.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndComment
function.info: End the current xml coment.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndDTD
function.info: End an xml DTD.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndDTDAttlist
function.info: End an xml DTD attribute list.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndDTDElement
function.info: End an xml DTD element.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndDTDEntity
function.info: End an xml DTD entity.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndDocument
function.info: End an xml document. All open elements are closed

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndElement
function.info: End the current xml element.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterEndPI
function.info: End the current xml PI.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterFlush
function.info: Flush the output buffer.

return.info: the bytes written (may be 0 because of buffering) or -1 in case of error

function.name: xmlTextWriterFullEndElement

function.name: xmlURIEscape
function.info: Escaping routine, does not do validity checks ! It will try to escape the chars needing this, but this is heuristic based it's impossible to be sure.

return.info: an copy of the string, but escaped 25 May 2001 Uses xmlParseURI and xmlURIEscapeStr to try to escape correctly according to RFC2396. - Carl Douglas

arg.name: str
arg.info: the string of the URI to escape

function.name: xmlURIEscapeStr
function.info: This routine escapes a string to hex, ignoring reserved characters (a-z) and the characters in the exception list.

return.info: a new escaped string or NULL in case of error.

arg.name: list
arg.info: exception list string of chars not to escape

function.name: xmlURIUnescapeString
function.info: Unescaping routine, does not do validity checks ! Output is direct unsigned char translation of %XX values (no encoding)

return.info: an copy of the string, but unescaped

arg.name: len
arg.info: the length in bytes to unescape (or <= 0 to indicate full string)

function.name: xmlUTF8Charcmp
function.info: compares the two UCS4 values

return.info: result of the compare as with xmlStrncmp

function.name: xmlUTF8Size
function.info: calculates the internal size of a UTF8 character

return.info: the numbers of bytes in the character, -1 on format error

function.name: xmlUTF8Strlen
function.info: compute the length of an UTF8 string, it doesn't do a full UTF8 checking of the content of the string.

return.info: the number of characters in the string or -1 in case of error

arg.name: utf
arg.info: a sequence of UTF-8 encoded bytes

function.name: xmlUTF8Strloc
function.info: a function to provide the relative location of a UTF8 char

return.info: the relative character position of the desired char or -1 if not found

arg.name: utfchar
arg.info: the UTF8 character to be found

function.name: xmlUTF8Strndup
function.info: a strndup for array of UTF8's

return.info: a new UTF8 * or NULL

function.name: xmlUTF8Strpos
function.info: a function to provide the equivalent of fetching a character from a string array

return.info: a pointer to the UTF8 character or NULL

arg.name: pos
arg.info: the position of the desired UTF8 char (in chars)

function.name: xmlUTF8Strsize
function.info: storage size of an UTF8 string the behaviour is not garanteed if the input string is not UTF-8

return.info: the storage size of the first 'len' characters of ARRAY

arg.name: utf
arg.info: a sequence of UTF-8 encoded bytes

arg.name: len
arg.info: the number of characters in the array

function.name: xmlUTF8Strsub
function.info: Create a substring from a given UTF-8 string Note: positions are given in units of UTF-8 chars

return.info: a pointer to a newly created string or NULL if any problem

arg.name: utf
arg.info: a sequence of UTF-8 encoded bytes

function.name: xmlUnlinkNode
function.info: Unlink a node from it's current context, the node is not freed

function.name: xmlUnlockLibrary
function.info: xmlUnlockLibrary() is used to release a re-entrant lock on the libxml2 library.

function.name: xmlUnsetNsProp
function.info: Remove an attribute carried by a node.

return.info: 0 if successful, -1 if not found

function.name: xmlUnsetProp
function.info: Remove an attribute carried by a node.

return.info: 0 if successful, -1 if not found

function.name: xmlValidBuildContentModel
function.info: (Re)Build the automata associated to the content model of this element

return.info: 1 in case of success, 0 in case of error

function.name: xmlValidCtxtNormalizeAttributeValue
function.info: Does the validation related extra step of the normalization of attribute values: If the declared value is not CDATA, then the XML processor must further process the normalized attribute value by discarding any leading and trailing space (#x20) characters, and by replacing sequences of space (#x20) characters by single space (#x20) character. Also check VC: Standalone Document Declaration in P32, and update ctxt->valid accordingly

return.info: a new normalized string if normalization is needed, NULL otherwise the caller must free the returned value.

function.name: xmlValidGetPotentialChildren
function.info: Build/extend a list of potential children allowed by the content tree

return.info: the number of element in the list, or -1 in case of error.

arg.name: list
arg.info: an array to store the list of child names

arg.name: len
arg.info: a pointer to the number of element in the list

function.name: xmlValidGetValidElements
function.info: This function returns the list of authorized children to insert within an existing tree while respecting the validity constraints forced by the Dtd. The insertion point is defined using @prev and @next in the following ways: to insert before 'node': xmlValidGetValidElements(node->prev, node, ... to insert next 'node': xmlValidGetValidElements(node, node->next, ... to replace 'node': xmlValidGetValidElements(node->prev, node->next, ... to prepend a child to 'node': xmlValidGetValidElements(NULL, node->childs, to append a child to 'node': xmlValidGetValidElements(node->last, NULL, ... pointers to the element names are inserted at the beginning of the array and do not need to be freed.

return.info: the number of element in the list, or -1 in case of error. If the function returns the value @max the caller is invited to grow the receiving array and retry.

arg.name: names
arg.info: an array to store the list of child names

function.name: xmlValidNormalizeAttributeValue
function.info: Does the validation related extra step of the normalization of attribute values: If the declared value is not CDATA, then the XML processor must further process the normalized attribute value by discarding any leading and trailing space (#x20) characters, and by replacing sequences of space (#x20) characters by single space (#x20) character.

return.info: a new normalized string if normalization is needed, NULL otherwise the caller must free the returned value.

function.name: xmlValidateAttributeDecl
function.info: Try to validate a single attribute definition basically it does the following checks as described by the XML-1.0 recommendation: - [ VC: Attribute Default Legal ] - [ VC: Enumeration ] - [ VC: ID Attribute Default ] The ID/IDREF uniqueness and matching are done separately

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateAttributeValue
function.info: Validate that the given attribute value match the proper production [ VC: ID ] Values of type ID must match the Name production.... [ VC: IDREF ] Values of type IDREF must match the Name production, and values of type IDREFS must match Names ... [ VC: Entity Name ] Values of type ENTITY must match the Name production, values of type ENTITIES must match Names ... [ VC: Name Token ] Values of type NMTOKEN must match the Nmtoken production; values of type NMTOKENS must match Nmtokens.

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateDocument
function.info: Try to validate the document instance basically it does the all the checks described by the XML Rec i.e. validates the internal and external subset (if present) and validate the document tree.

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateDocumentFinal
function.info: Does the final step for the document validation once all the incremental validation steps have been completed basically it does the following checks described by the XML Rec Check all the IDREF/IDREFS attributes definition for validity

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateDtd
function.info: Try to validate the document against the dtd instance Basically it does check all the definitions in the DtD. Note the the internal subset (if present) is de-coupled (i.e. not used), which could give problems if ID or IDREF is present.

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateDtdFinal
function.info: Does the final step for the dtds validation once all the subsets have been parsed basically it does the following checks described by the XML Rec - check that ENTITY and ENTITIES type attributes default or possible values matches one of the defined entities. - check that NOTATION type attributes default or possible values matches one of the defined notations.

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 if invalid and -1 if not well-formed

function.name: xmlValidateElement
function.info: Try to validate the subtree under an element

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateElementDecl
function.info: Try to validate a single element definition basically it does the following checks as described by the XML-1.0 recommendation: - [ VC: One ID per Element Type ] - [ VC: No Duplicate Types ] - [ VC: Unique Element Type Declaration ]

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateNCName
function.info: Check that a value conforms to the lexical space of NCName

return.info: 0 if this validates, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

arg.name: space
arg.info: allow spaces in front and end of the string

function.name: xmlValidateNMToken
function.info: Check that a value conforms to the lexical space of NMToken

return.info: 0 if this validates, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

arg.name: space
arg.info: allow spaces in front and end of the string

function.name: xmlValidateName
function.info: Check that a value conforms to the lexical space of Name

return.info: 0 if this validates, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

arg.name: space
arg.info: allow spaces in front and end of the string

function.name: xmlValidateNameValue
function.info: Validate that the given value match Name production

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateNamesValue
function.info: Validate that the given value match Names production

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateNmtokenValue
function.info: Validate that the given value match Nmtoken production [ VC: Name Token ]

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateNmtokensValue
function.info: Validate that the given value match Nmtokens production [ VC: Name Token ]

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateNotationDecl
function.info: Try to validate a single notation definition basically it does the following checks as described by the XML-1.0 recommendation: - it seems that no validity constraint exists on notation declarations But this function get called anyway ...

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateNotationUse
function.info: Validate that the given name match a notation declaration. - [ VC: Notation Declared ]

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateOneAttribute
function.info: Try to validate a single attribute for an element basically it does the following checks as described by the XML-1.0 recommendation: - [ VC: Attribute Value Type ] - [ VC: Fixed Attribute Default ] - [ VC: Entity Name ] - [ VC: Name Token ] - [ VC: ID ] - [ VC: IDREF ] - [ VC: Entity Name ] - [ VC: Notation Attributes ] The ID/IDREF uniqueness and matching are done separately

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateOneElement
function.info: Try to validate a single element and it's attributes, basically it does the following checks as described by the XML-1.0 recommendation: - [ VC: Element Valid ] - [ VC: Required Attribute ] Then call xmlValidateOneAttribute() for each attribute present. The ID/IDREF checkings are done separately

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidateOneNamespace
function.info: Try to validate a single namespace declaration for an element basically it does the following checks as described by the XML-1.0 recommendation: - [ VC: Attribute Value Type ] - [ VC: Fixed Attribute Default ] - [ VC: Entity Name ] - [ VC: Name Token ] - [ VC: ID ] - [ VC: IDREF ] - [ VC: Entity Name ] - [ VC: Notation Attributes ] The ID/IDREF uniqueness and matching are done separately

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidatePopElement
function.info: Pop the element end from the validation stack.

return.info: 1 if no validation problem was found or 0 otherwise

arg.name: qname
arg.info: the qualified name as appearing in the serialization

function.name: xmlValidatePushCData
function.info: check the CData parsed for validation in the current stack

return.info: 1 if no validation problem was found or 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlValidatePushElement
function.info: Push a new element start on the validation stack.

return.info: 1 if no validation problem was found or 0 otherwise

arg.name: qname
arg.info: the qualified name as appearing in the serialization

function.name: xmlValidateQName
function.info: Check that a value conforms to the lexical space of QName

return.info: 0 if this validates, a positive error code number otherwise and -1 in case of internal or API error.

arg.name: space
arg.info: allow spaces in front and end of the string

function.name: xmlValidateRoot
function.info: Try to validate a the root element basically it does the following check as described by the XML-1.0 recommendation: - [ VC: Root Element Type ] it doesn't try to recurse or apply other check to the element

return.info: 1 if valid or 0 otherwise

functype.name: xmlValidityErrorFunc
functype.info: Callback called when a validity error is found. This is a message oriented function similar to an *printf function.

arg.name: ctx
arg.info: usually an xmlValidCtxtPtr to a validity error context, but comes from ctxt->userData (which normally contains such a pointer); ctxt->userData can be changed by the user.

arg.name: msg
arg.info: the string to format *printf like vararg

functype.name: xmlValidityWarningFunc
functype.info: Callback called when a validity warning is found. This is a message oriented function similar to an *printf function.

arg.name: ctx
arg.info: usually an xmlValidCtxtPtr to a validity error context, but comes from ctxt->userData (which normally contains such a pointer); ctxt->userData can be changed by the user.

arg.name: msg
arg.info: the string to format *printf like vararg

function.name: xmlXIncludeFreeContext
function.info: Free an XInclude context

function.name: xmlXIncludeNewContext
function.info: Creates a new XInclude context

return.info: the new set

function.name: xmlXIncludeProcess
function.info: Implement the XInclude substitution on the XML document @doc

return.info: 0 if no substitution were done, -1 if some processing failed or the number of substitutions done.

function.name: xmlXIncludeProcessFlags
function.info: Implement the XInclude substitution on the XML document @doc

return.info: 0 if no substitution were done, -1 if some processing failed or the number of substitutions done.

arg.name: flags
arg.info: a set of xmlParserOption used for parsing XML includes

function.name: xmlXIncludeProcessNode
function.info: Implement the XInclude substitution for the given subtree reusing the informations and data coming from the given context.

return.info: 0 if no substitution were done, -1 if some processing failed or the number of substitutions done.

arg.name: node
arg.info: a node in an XML document

function.name: xmlXIncludeProcessTree
function.info: Implement the XInclude substitution for the given subtree

return.info: 0 if no substitution were done, -1 if some processing failed or the number of substitutions done.

arg.name: tree
arg.info: a node in an XML document

function.name: xmlXIncludeProcessTreeFlags
function.info: Implement the XInclude substitution for the given subtree

return.info: 0 if no substitution were done, -1 if some processing failed or the number of substitutions done.

arg.name: tree
arg.info: a node in an XML document

arg.name: flags
arg.info: a set of xmlParserOption used for parsing XML includes

function.name: xmlXIncludeSetFlags
function.info: Set the flags used for further processing of XML resources.

return.info: 0 in case of success and -1 in case of error.

arg.name: flags
arg.info: a set of xmlParserOption used for parsing XML includes

function.name: xmlXPathAddValues
function.info: Implement the add operation on XPath objects: The numeric operators convert their operands to numbers as if by calling the number function.

functype.name: xmlXPathAxisFunc
functype.info: An axis traversal function. To traverse an axis, the engine calls the first time with cur == NULL and repeat until the function returns NULL indicating the end of the axis traversal.

return.info: the next node in that axis or NULL if at the end of the axis.

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the previous node being explored on that axis

function.name: xmlXPathBooleanFunction
function.info: Implement the boolean() XPath function boolean boolean(object) The boolean function converts its argument to a boolean as follows: - a number is true if and only if it is neither positive or negative zero nor NaN - a node-set is true if and only if it is non-empty - a string is true if and only if its length is non-zero

function.name: xmlXPathCastBooleanToNumber
function.info: Converts a boolean to its number value

return.info: the number value

function.name: xmlXPathCastBooleanToString
function.info: Converts a boolean to its string value.

return.info: a newly allocated string.

function.name: xmlXPathCeilingFunction
function.info: Implement the ceiling() XPath function number ceiling(number) The ceiling function returns the smallest (closest to negative infinity) number that is not less than the argument and that is an integer.

function.name: xmlXPathCmpNodes
function.info: Compare two nodes w.r.t document order

return.info: -2 in case of error 1 if first point < second point, 0 if it's the same node, -1 otherwise

function.name: xmlXPathCompareValues
function.info: Implement the compare operation on XPath objects: @arg1 < @arg2 (1, 1, ... @arg1 <= @arg2 (1, 0, ... @arg1 > @arg2 (0, 1, ... @arg1 >= @arg2 (0, 0, ... When neither object to be compared is a node-set and the operator is <=, <, >=, >, then the objects are compared by converted both objects to numbers and comparing the numbers according to IEEE 754. The < comparison will be true if and only if the first number is less than the second number. The <= comparison will be true if and only if the first number is less than or equal to the second number. The > comparison will be true if and only if the first number is greater than the second number. The >= comparison will be true if and only if the first number is greater than or equal to the second number.

return.info: 1 if the comparison succeeded, 0 if it failed

function.name: xmlXPathEvalPredicate
function.info: Evaluate a predicate result for the current node. A PredicateExpr is evaluated by evaluating the Expr and converting the result to a boolean. If the result is a number, the result will be converted to true if the number is equal to the position of the context node in the context node list (as returned by the position function) and will be converted to false otherwise; if the result is not a number, then the result will be converted as if by a call to the boolean function.

return.info: 1 if predicate is true, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlXPathEvaluatePredicateResult
function.info: Evaluate a predicate result for the current node. A PredicateExpr is evaluated by evaluating the Expr and converting the result to a boolean. If the result is a number, the result will be converted to true if the number is equal to the position of the context node in the context node list (as returned by the position function) and will be converted to false otherwise; if the result is not a number, then the result will be converted as if by a call to the boolean function.

return.info: 1 if predicate is true, 0 otherwise

function.name: xmlXPathIdFunction
function.info: Implement the id() XPath function node-set id(object) The id function selects elements by their unique ID (see [5.2.1 Unique IDs]). When the argument to id is of type node-set, then the result is the union of the result of applying id to the string value of each of the nodes in the argument node-set. When the argument to id is of any other type, the argument is converted to a string as if by a call to the string function; the string is split into a whitespace-separated list of tokens (whitespace is any sequence of characters matching the production S); the result is a node-set containing the elements in the same document as the context node that have a unique ID equal to any of the tokens in the list.

function.name: xmlXPathLangFunction
function.info: Implement the lang() XPath function boolean lang(string) The lang function returns true or false depending on whether the language of the context node as specified by xml:lang attributes is the same as or is a sublanguage of the language specified by the argument string. The language of the context node is determined by the value of the xml:lang attribute on the context node, or, if the context node has no xml:lang attribute, by the value of the xml:lang attribute on the nearest ancestor of the context node that has an xml:lang attribute. If there is no such attribute, then lang

return.info: the nodes in @nodes1 that precede the first node in @nodes2 in document order, @nodes1 if @nodes2 is NULL or empty or an empty node-set if @nodes1 doesn't contain @nodes2

function.name: xmlXPathLocalNameFunction
function.info: Implement the local-name() XPath function string local-name(node-set?) The local-name function returns a string containing the local part of the name of the node in the argument node-set that is first in document order. If the node-set is empty or the first node has no name, an empty string is returned. If the argument is omitted it defaults to the context node.

function.name: xmlXPathModValues
function.info: Implement the mod operation on XPath objects: @arg1 / @arg2 The numeric operators convert their operands to numbers as if by calling the number function.

function.name: xmlXPathMultValues
function.info: Implement the multiply operation on XPath objects: The numeric operators convert their operands to numbers as if by calling the number function.

function.name: xmlXPathNamespaceURIFunction
function.info: Implement the namespace-uri() XPath function string namespace-uri(node-set?) The namespace-uri function returns a string containing the namespace URI of the expanded name of the node in the argument node-set that is first in document order. If the node-set is empty, the first node has no name, or the expanded name has no namespace URI, an empty string is returned. If the argument is omitted it defaults to the context node.

function.name: xmlXPathNextAncestor
function.info: Traversal function for the "ancestor" direction the ancestor axis contains the ancestors of the context node; the ancestors of the context node consist of the parent of context node and the parent's parent and so on; the nodes are ordered in reverse document order; thus the parent is the first node on the axis, and the parent's parent is the second node on the axis

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextAncestorOrSelf
function.info: Traversal function for the "ancestor-or-self" direction he ancestor-or-self axis contains the context node and ancestors of the context node in reverse document order; thus the context node is the first node on the axis, and the context node's parent the second; parent here is defined the same as with the parent axis.

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextAttribute
function.info: Traversal function for the "attribute" direction TODO: support DTD inherited default attributes

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current attribute in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextChild
function.info: Traversal function for the "child" direction The child axis contains the children of the context node in document order.

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextDescendant
function.info: Traversal function for the "descendant" direction the descendant axis contains the descendants of the context node in document order; a descendant is a child or a child of a child and so on.

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextDescendantOrSelf
function.info: Traversal function for the "descendant-or-self" direction the descendant-or-self axis contains the context node and the descendants of the context node in document order; thus the context node is the first node on the axis, and the first child of the context node is the second node on the axis

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextFollowing
function.info: Traversal function for the "following" direction The following axis contains all nodes in the same document as the context node that are after the context node in document order, excluding any descendants and excluding attribute nodes and namespace nodes; the nodes are ordered in document order

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextFollowingSibling
function.info: Traversal function for the "following-sibling" direction The following-sibling axis contains the following siblings of the context node in document order.

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextNamespace
function.info: Traversal function for the "namespace" direction the namespace axis contains the namespace nodes of the context node; the order of nodes on this axis is implementation-defined; the axis will be empty unless the context node is an element We keep the XML namespace node at the end of the list.

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current attribute in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextParent
function.info: Traversal function for the "parent" direction The parent axis contains the parent of the context node, if there is one.

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextPreceding
function.info: Traversal function for the "preceding" direction the preceding axis contains all nodes in the same document as the context node that are before the context node in document order, excluding any ancestors and excluding attribute nodes and namespace nodes; the nodes are ordered in reverse document order

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextPrecedingSibling
function.info: Traversal function for the "preceding-sibling" direction The preceding-sibling axis contains the preceding siblings of the context node in reverse document order; the first preceding sibling is first on the axis; the sibling preceding that node is the second on the axis and so on.

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNextSelf
function.info: Traversal function for the "self" direction The self axis contains just the context node itself

return.info: the next element following that axis

arg.name: cur
arg.info: the current node in the traversal

function.name: xmlXPathNormalizeFunction
function.info: Implement the normalize-space() XPath function string normalize-space(string?) The normalize-space function returns the argument string with white space normalized by stripping leading and trailing whitespace and replacing sequences of whitespace characters by a single space. Whitespace characters are the same allowed by the S production in XML. If the argument is omitted, it defaults to the context node converted to a string, in other words the value of the context node.

function.info: Implement the starts-with() XPath function boolean starts-with(string, string) The starts-with function returns true if the first argument string starts with the second argument string, and otherwise returns false.

function.name: xmlXPathStringEvalNumber
function.info: [30a] Float ::= Number ('e' Digits?)? [30] Number ::= Digits ('.' Digits?)? | '.' Digits [31] Digits ::= [0-9]+ Compile a Number in the string In complement of the Number expression, this function also handles negative values : '-' Number.

return.info: the double value.

function.name: xmlXPathStringFunction
function.info: Implement the string() XPath function string string(object?) The string function converts an object to a string as follows: - A node-set is converted to a string by returning the value of the node in the node-set that is first in document order. If the node-set is empty, an empty string is returned. - A number is converted to a string as follows + NaN is converted to the string NaN + positive zero is converted to the string 0 + negative zero is converted to the string 0 + positive infinity is converted to the string Infinity + negative infinity is converted to the string -Infinity + if the number is an integer, the number is represented in decimal form as a Number with no decimal point and no leading zeros, preceded by a minus sign (-) if the number is negative + otherwise, the number is represented in decimal form as a Number including a decimal point with at least one digit before the decimal point and at least one digit after the decimal point, preceded by a minus sign (-) if the number is negative; there must be no leading zeros before the decimal point apart possibly from the one required digit immediately before the decimal point; beyond the one required digit after the decimal point there must be as many, but only as many, more digits as are needed to uniquely distinguish the number from all other IEEE 754 numeric values. - The boolean false value is converted to the string false. The boolean true value is converted to the string true. If the argument is omitted, it defaults to a node-set with the context node as its only member.

function.name: xmlXPathStringLengthFunction
function.info: Implement the string-length() XPath function number string-length(string?) The string-length returns the number of characters in the string (see [3.6 Strings]). If the argument is omitted, it defaults to the context node converted to a string, in other words the value of the context node.

function.name: xmlXPathSubValues
function.info: Implement the subtraction operation on XPath objects: The numeric operators convert their operands to numbers as if by calling the number function.

function.name: xmlXPathSubstringAfterFunction
function.info: Implement the substring-after() XPath function string substring-after(string, string) The substring-after function returns the substring of the first argument string that follows the first occurrence of the second argument string in the first argument string, or the empty stringi if the first argument string does not contain the second argument string. For example, substring-after("1999/04/01","/") returns 04/01, and substring-after("1999/04/01","19") returns 99/04/01.

function.name: xmlXPathSubstringBeforeFunction
function.info: Implement the substring-before() XPath function string substring-before(string, string) The substring-before function returns the substring of the first argument string that precedes the first occurrence of the second argument string in the first argument string, or the empty string if the first argument string does not contain the second argument string. For example, substring-before("1999/04/01","/") returns 1999.

function.name: xmlXPathSubstringFunction
function.info: Implement the substring() XPath function string substring(string, number, number?) The substring function returns the substring of the first argument starting at the position specified in the second argument with length specified in the third argument. For example, substring("12345",2,3) returns "234". If the third argument is not specified, it returns the substring starting at the position specified in the second argument and continuing to the end of the string. For example, substring("12345",2) returns "2345". More precisely, each character in the string (see [3.6 Strings]) is considered to have a numeric position: the position of the first character is 1, the position of the second character is 2 and so on. The returned substring contains those characters for which the position of the character is greater than or equal to the second argument and, if the third argument is specified, less than the sum of the second and third arguments; the comparisons and addition used for the above follow the standard IEEE 754 rules. Thus: - substring("12345", 1.5, 2.6) returns "234" - substring("12345", 0, 3) returns "12" - substring("12345", 0 div 0, 3) returns "" - substring("12345", 1, 0 div 0) returns "" - substring("12345", -42, 1 div 0) returns "12345" - substring("12345", -1 div 0, 1 div 0) returns ""

function.name: xmlXPathSumFunction
function.info: Implement the sum() XPath function number sum(node-set) The sum function returns the sum of the values of the nodes in the argument node-set.

function.name: xmlXPathTrailing
function.info: Implements the EXSLT - Sets trailing() function: node-set set:trailing (node-set, node-set) @nodes1 and @nodes2 are sorted by document order, then #xmlXPathTrailingSorted is called.

return.info: the nodes in @nodes1 that follow the first node in @nodes2 in document order, @nodes1 if @nodes2 is NULL or empty or an empty node-set if @nodes1 doesn't contain @nodes2

function.name: xmlXPathTrailingSorted
function.info: Implements the EXSLT - Sets trailing() function: node-set set:trailing (node-set, node-set)

return.info: the nodes in @nodes1 that follow the first node in @nodes2 in document order, @nodes1 if @nodes2 is NULL or empty or an empty node-set if @nodes1 doesn't contain @nodes2

arg.name: nodes1
arg.info: a node-set, sorted by document order

arg.name: nodes2
arg.info: a node-set, sorted by document order

function.name: xmlXPathTranslateFunction
function.info: Implement the translate() XPath function string translate(string, string, string) The translate function returns the first argument string with occurrences of characters in the second argument string replaced by the character at the corresponding position in the third argument string. For example, translate("bar","abc","ABC") returns the string BAr. If there is a character in the second argument string with no character at a corresponding position in the third argument string (because the second argument string is longer than the third argument string), then occurrences of that character in the first argument string are removed. For example, translate("--aaa--","abc-","ABC")
